entries.name: Aberrant Form
entries.description: *Reaction:* The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zealot must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom Reaction Roll or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Weirdly Pliable
entries.description: *Passive:* The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (psychic).

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15)):At will: detect thoughts, minor illusion1/day each: arcane gate, hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Void Warp (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the zealot teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself, leaving a churning void in the space it left. immediately after it teleports, each creature within 30 feet of the void other than the zealot must make a difficulty (15) strength reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, a creature takes 18 (4d8) force damage and is pulled to the unoccupied space closest to the void. on a successful reaction roll, the creature takes half as much damage only. the void then disappears.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting

entries.name: Insatiable Greed
entries.description: *Passive:* The abhorrent overlord can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The abhorrent overlord has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from the abjurer must make a difficulty (16) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the abjurer. on a successful reaction roll, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The aboleth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Eldritch Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If destroyed, the aboleth gains a new body in 5d10 days, reviving with all its HP in the Far Realm or another location chosen by the DM.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the aboleth fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Mucus Cloud
entries.description: *Reaction:* While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by mucus. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14), each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the aboleth at the end of the aboleth's turn. Failure: The target is cursed. Until the curse ends, the target's skin becomes slimy, the target can breathe air and water, and it can't regain HP unless it is underwater.While the cursed creature is outside a body of water, the creature takes 6 (1d12) Acid damage at the end of every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before those minutes have passed.

entries.name: Probing Telepathy
entries.description: *Passive:* If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Consume Memories
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to intelligence reaction roll: difficulty (16), one creature within 30 feet that is charmed or grappled by the aboleth. failure: 10 (3d6) psychic damage. success: half damage. failure or success: the aboleth gains the target's memories if the target is a humanoid and is reduced to 0 hp by this action.

entries.name: Dominate Mind (2/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to wisdom reaction roll: difficulty (16), one creature the aboleth can see within 30 feet. failure: the target has the charmed condition until the aboleth dies or is on a different plane of existence from the target. while charmed, the target acts as an ally to the aboleth and is under its control while within 60 feet of it. in addition, the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.the target repeats the reaction roll whenever it takes damage as well as after every 24 hours it spends at least 1 mile away from the aboleth, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Lash
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aboleth makes one tentacle attack.

entries.name: Psychic Drain
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to if the aboleth has at least one creature charmed or grappled, it uses consume memories and regains 5 (1d10) hp.

entries.name: Abolethic Vessel
entries.description: *Passive:* The spawn must obey its aboleth master.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The spawn can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries.description: *Passive:* The spawn takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes it goes without being immersed in water.

entries.description: *Passive:* The drone regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Spell Storing
entries.description: *Reaction:* A spellcaster who wears the drone's amulet can cause the drone to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the drone. The spell has no effect but is stored within the drone. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the drone casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the nullifier and can hear it must make a Difficulty (16) Wisdom Reaction Roll. Unless the Reaction Roll succeeds, the creature rolls a d8 to determine what it does during the current turn:1-4: The creature is stunned until the end of the turn.5-6: The creature is frightened until the end of the turn and uses its movement to get as far as possible from the nullifier.7-8: The creature doesn't move, and it uses its action to make one melee attack against a random creature (other than itself) if one is within reach. It otherwise does nothing

While under the effect of that confusion, the creature is immune to Foment Confusion.

The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.The charmed target can repeat the Reaction Roll whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can repeat the Reaction Roll when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Wielder Domination
entries.description: *Reaction:* A creature can grab the staff out of the air with a successful grapple check against the staff, and grappling the staff does not reduce the creature's speed. Any creature that successfully grapples the staff must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Charisma Reaction Roll or be charmed by the staff until the staff is no longer in its grasp. While the creature is charmed, the staff can issue commands to it, which the creature does its best to obey. The creature can repeat the Reaction Roll each time it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that successfully resists the staff's control can't be charmed by it for 24 hours.A creature holding the staff that isn't charmed by it can use an action to attempt to break the staff over a knee or against a solid surface, doing so with a successful Difficulty (17) Strength (Athletics) check. Breaking the staff in this manner destroys it.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the tree. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the tree dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the tree takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

entries.name: Discordant Song
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Aphemia shrieks a cacophony of magical sounds. Each humanoid within 120 feet of her must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be frightened of her until the song ends. A frightened creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the start of its turn while Aphemia is singing. A frightened creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's Reaction Roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Aphemia's Discordant Song for the next 24 hours. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

entries.name: Grave Calling Song
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Aphemia intones a low, growling magical melody. Every undead within 300 feet of her must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or fall under her control until the song ends. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing, and she can mentally command the undead under her control as part of the same bonus action. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

entries.description: *Passive:* If Arasta is reduced to 0 HP, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she regains 200 HP. In addition, Arasta's children immediately swarm over her body to protect her, granting her 100 temporary HP.

entries.name: Web of Hair (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Arasta unleashes her hair in the form of webbing that fills a 30-foot cube next to her. The web is difficult terrain, its area is lightly obscured, and it lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that moves into the web or that starts its turn there must make a Difficulty (21) Dexterity Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature is restrained while in the web. A creature can use an action to make a Difficulty (21) Strength check. On a success, it can free itself or a creature within 5 feet of it that is restrained by the web. This webbing is immune to all damage except magical fire. A 5-foot cube of the web is destroyed if it takes at least 20 fire damage from a spell or other magical source on a single turn.

While holding or carrying the tome, the arcanaloth can use its Banishing Claw action.The tome has AC 17; HP 35; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The tome regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the arcanaloth dies. If the tome is destroyed, the arcanaloth can create a new one when it finishes a Short or Long Rest.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When the hag drops to 0 HP, it dies only if it is within 30 feet of its anathema (a thing the DM chooses as the hag's most hated thing). Otherwise, the hag drops to 1 Hit Point and teleports to a harmless demiplane, and it can't return to the plane it left for 2d6 days. When the hag teleports away, each creature within 60 feet of the space it left is cursed. Until the curse ends, a creature has penalty on ability checks and saving throws, and the hag knows its location anywhere in the multiverse.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The archdruid magically transforms into a Beast or an Elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less and can remain in that form for up to 9 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form if it dies or falls unconscious. The archdruid can revert to its true form using a bonus action.While in a new form, the archdruid's stat block is replaced by the stat block of that form, except the archdruid keeps its current HP, its hit point maximum, this bonus action, its languages and ability to speak, and its Spellcasting action.The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to non-magical attacks.

entries.name: Mount
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the archon isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the archon and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the archon appears astride the mount, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the archon can't be surprised, and both it and its mount have bonus on Dexterity saving throws. If the archon is reduced to 0 HP while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 HP as well.

entries.name: Radiant Rebirth (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the archon is reduced to 0 HP, it regains 30 HP and springs back to its feet with a burst of radiance. Each creature of the archon's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll, or the creature takes 13 (3d8) radiant damage and is blinded until the start of the archon's turn.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the archon causes a corpse it can see within 30 feet of it to burst into a shower of radiant stars leaving no trace of it behind. everything it is wearing or carrying remains. each creature within 10 feet of the corpse when it bursts must succeed on a difficulty (16) dexterity reaction roll or take 22 (4d10) radiant damage.

entries.name: Eye of the Law
entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, the archon can target a creature it can see within 120 feet of it and determine which laws that creature has broken in the last 24 hours.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The archon's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks). The archon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: calm emotions, command, compelled duel

entries.name: Mount
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the archon isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the archon and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the archon appears astride the mount along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the archon can't be surprised, and both it and its mount gain bonus on Dexterity saving throws. If the archon is reduced to 0 HP while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 HP as well.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Pacifying Presence
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Each creature of the archon's choice that the archon can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Wisdom Reaction Roll, or else the target drops any weapons it is holding, ends its concentration on any spells or other effects, and becomes charmed by the archon for 1 minute. The charmed creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's Reaction Roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the archon's Pacifying Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Rejoin Mount
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. If the archon isn't mounted, it magically teleports to its steed and mounts it as long as the archon and its steed are on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Smite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target.

entries.name: Detention (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The archon targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Charisma Reaction Roll or be magically teleported to a harmless demiplane until the end of the archon's next turn, whereupon the target reappears in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Holy Word (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to wisdom reaction roll: difficulty (17), each enemy in a 20-foot emanation originating from the archpriest. failure: 21 (6d6) radiant damage, and the target has the stunned condition until the end of the archpriest's next turn. success: half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The archpriest casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17)):At will: Light, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Flame Strike (level 6 version), Greater Restoration, Raise Dead, Zone of Truth

entries.name: Divine Aid (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The priest casts Bless, Dispel Magic, Healing Word, or Lesser Restoration, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Crackling Death
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the arclight phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a Difficulty (18) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 36 (8d8) lightning damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion destroys the phoenix but leaves behind a Tiny, warm egg with a mizzium shell. The egg contains the embryo of a new arclight phoenix. It hatches when it is in the area of a spell that deals lightning damage, or if a creature touches the egg and expends spell slots whose combined levels equal 13 or more. When it hatches, the egg releases a new arclight phoenix that appears in the egg's space.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: *Reaction:* The arclight phoenix doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Grounded Lightning
entries.description: *Action:* The first time on a turn that the arclight phoenix touches the ground, it takes 11 (2d10) force damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The arclight phoenix sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

entries.name: Lightning Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The arclight phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage. In addition, the arclight phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Arclight Touch
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 6d8 lightning damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The armanite has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Lightning Lance (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 8d8 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: *Passive:* The tiger has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d10+5 damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d6+5 damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the elemental dies, it explodes in a burst of colored light. Each creature within 5 feet of the elemental must succeed on a Difficulty (11) Constitution Reaction Roll or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Joyful Flare
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d4+1 fire damage.

entries.name: Melancholic Bolt
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d4+1 cold damage.

entries.name: Captivating Artistry (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elemental targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. the target must succeed on a difficulty (12) charisma reaction roll or be charmed for 1 minute. the charmed target can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Ash Cloud
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the zombie dies, it leaves a cloud of ash that lasts for 5 minutes but does not obscure vision.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+1 damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: *Reaction:* The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution Reaction Roll against the caster's spell Reaction Roll DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the armor drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Ashen Flying Sword

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: *Reaction:* The sword is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the sword must succeed on a Constitution Reaction Roll against the caster's spell Reaction Roll DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the sword drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the sword remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal sword.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+1 damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Divine Eminence
entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6 damage.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Ashen Heir Assassin

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: *Passive:* During its first turn, the assassin has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The assassin deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has a bonus on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have penalty on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the ashen knight drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: *Passive:* The ashen knight has a bonus on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Aura of Silence
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the ashen rider, the rider can force that creature to make a Difficulty (18) Wisdom Reaction Roll if the rider can see it. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature can't speak and is deafened until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The ashen rider's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18)). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: command, compelled duel1/day each: banishment, blade barrier

entries.name: Mount
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the ashen rider isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the ashen rider and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the ashen rider appears astride the mount along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying.While mounted and not incapacitated, the ashen rider can't be surprised, and both it and its mount have bonus on Dexterity saving throws. If the ashen rider is reduced to 0 HP while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 HP as well.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the ashen rider makes an attack using its ashen blade or bolt of ash.

entries.name: Coordinated Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target.

entries.name: Reduce to Ash (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The ashen rider targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Constitution Reaction Roll, or it takes 27 (5d10) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the target's hit point maximum is reduced to 0, its body and everything it is wearing and carrying, except for magic items, are reduced to ash. A creature reduced to ash can't be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the shambling mound drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Medium range area. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 2d8+4 damage and have the Restrained and Blinded conditions until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the veteran drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Ashen Creature
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the horse drops to 0 HP, it is reduced to a pile of ash, and any equipment it was wearing or carrying falls to the ground.

entries.name: Trampling Charge
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d6+4 damage.

name: Aspect of Bahamut

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the aspect fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Platinum Brilliance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the aspect would be reduced to 0 HP, his current hit point total instead resets to 500 HP, he recharges his Breath Weapon, and he regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Bahamut after his Platinum Brilliance activates.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a Far range cone. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 13d10 radiant damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The aspect magically transforms into any Humanoid or Beast, while retaining his game statistics (other than his size). This transformation ends if the aspect is reduced to 0 HP or if he uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aspect makes one claw or tail attack.

entries.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aspect makes one bite attack. if the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a difficulty (27) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened of the aspect until the end of the target's next turn.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush, Overwhelm
original_cr: 30 (XP 155,000, or 310,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +9)

name: Aspect of Tiamat

entries.name: Chromatic Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the aspect would be reduced to 0 HP, her current hit point total instead resets to 500 HP, she recharges her Chromatic Flames, and she regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Tiamat after her Chromatic Wrath activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the aspect fails a Reaction Roll, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Chromatic Flames (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (27). Targets who fail take 11d12 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aspect makes one claw or tail attack.

entries.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aspect makes one bite attack. if the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a difficulty (27) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened of the aspect until the end of its next turn.

motives_tactics: Burn enemies, Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush
original_cr: 30 (XP 155,000, or 310,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +9)

entries.name: Hunger of the Void
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the aspirant is reduced to 0 HP, its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, are sucked into a void and destroyed. Creatures in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the aspirant must make a Difficulty (11) Strength Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, a creature takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and is pulled 10 feet straight toward the aspirant's space. On a successful Reaction Roll, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Sinister Devotion
entries.description: *Passive:* The aspirant has a bonus on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+1 damage.

name: Assassin

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the assassin takes the dash, disengage, or hide action.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Tactician
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to spotlight this adversary and two allies within Close range.

motives_tactics: Command allies, Coordinate attacks, Maintain authority, Ambush

name: Assassin Vine

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the assassin vine remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+4 poison damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Entangling Vines
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the assassin vine can animate normal vines and roots on the ground in a 15-foot square within 30 feet of it. these plants turn the ground in that area into difficult terrain. a creature in that area when the effect begins must succeed on a difficulty (13) strength reaction roll or be restrained by entangling vines and roots. a creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a difficulty (13) strength (athletics) check, freeing itself on a successful check. the effect ends after 1 minute or when the assassin vine dies or uses entangling vines again.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: *Passive:* Asteria wears Winged Boots, which grant her a flying speed (included in her statistics). She also carries one half of a pair of Sending Stones; the other half of the pair is held by Euryale.

entries.name: Guardian Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* Whenever a creature of Asteria's choice within 30 feet of her makes a Reaction Roll, Asteria can give the creature bonus on the Reaction Roll (no action required). This trait doesn't function if Asteria has the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Asteria fails a Reaction Roll, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

entries.name: Bursting Benediction
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Asteria causes a burst of magical energy to envelop one creature she can see within 60 feet of herself. The target must make a Difficulty (19) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 40 (9d8) force damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. Asteria or another creature that she can see within 60 feet of herself then regains 10 HP.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Asteria casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (19)):At will: Guidance, Light, Thaumaturgy2/day each: Bless, Freedom of Movement, Greater Restoration, Plane Shift (self only), Protection from Evil and Good, Revivify

entries.name: Empowering Aegis (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to summon 1 ally, who appear at Far range.

entries.name: Brazen Strike
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to asteria makes one radiant blade attack.

entries.name: Nimble Sprint
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to asteria moves up to her speed. this movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Asteria uses Spellcasting.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* While it has at least 1 hit point, the astral blight sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The blight doesn't require air or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (cold).

entries.name: Antimagic Cone
entries.description: *Passive:* The dreadnought's eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, it decides which way the cone faces. The cone doesn't function while the eye is closed or while the dreadnought is blinded.

entries.name: Astral Entity
entries.description: *Passive:* The dreadnought can't leave the Astral Plane, nor can it be banished or otherwise transported out of that plane.

entries.name: Demiplanar Donjon
entries.description: *Passive:* Anything the dreadnought swallows is transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a wish spell or the dreadnought's Bite and Donjon Visit. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the plane shift spell. The demiplane resembles a stone cave roughly 1,000 feet in diameter with a ceiling 100 feet high. Like a stomach, it contains the remains of past meals. The dreadnought can't be harmed from within the demiplane. If the dreadnought dies, the demiplane disappears, and everything inside it appears around the dreadnought's corpse. The demiplane is otherwise indestructible.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the dreadnought fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Sever Silver Cord
entries.description: *Passive:* If the dreadnought scores a critical hit against a creature traveling by means of the astral projection spell, the dreadnought can cut the target's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The dreadnought doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the dreadnought makes one claw attack.

entries.name: Donjon Visit (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one huge or smaller creature that the dreadnought can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (19) charisma reaction roll or be teleported to an unoccupied space on the floor of the demiplanar donjon. at the end of the target's next turn, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entries.name: Psychic Projection (Costs 3 Actions)

Failure or Success: If the balor dies outside the Abyss, it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its HP somewhere in the Abyss.

name: Barghest

entries.name: Fire Banishment
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Charisma Reaction Roll or be instantly banished to Gehenna

entries.name: Soul Feeding
entries.description: *Passive:* The barghest can feed on the corpse of a Fey or Humanoid it killed within the past 10 minutes. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the corpse. The victim's soul is trapped in the barghest for 24 hours, after which time it is digested and the person is incapable of being revived. If the barghest dies before the soul is digested, the soul is released. While a soul is trapped in the barghest, any magic that tries to restore the soul to life has a 50 percent chance of failing and being wasted.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the barkburr move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the barkburr is animate.

Any equipment the target is wearing or carrying is absorbed into the tree's bark.

On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the Stench of all barrowghasts for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to strength reaction roll: difficulty (18), one large or smaller creature the behir can see within 5 feet. failure: 28 (5d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. the target has the grappled condition (escape difficulty (16)), and it has the restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale thunder in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (16). Targets who fail take 12d10 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to dexterity reaction roll: difficulty (18), one large or smaller creature grappled by the behir (the behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time). failure: the behir swallows the target, which is no longer grappled. while swallowed, a creature has the blinded and restrained conditions, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns.if the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a difficulty (14) constitution reaction roll at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 10 feet of the behir and has the prone condition. if the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the beholder fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The beholder randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):1: Charm Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. Success: Half damage only.2: Paralyzing Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.3: Fear Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.4: Slowing Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target's Speed is halved; the target can't take Reactions; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. Success: Half damage only.5: Enervation Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 13 (3d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain HP. Success: Half damage only.6: Telekinetic Ray. Strength Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16) (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). Failure: The beholder moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder has the Incapacitated condition. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.7: Sleep Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16) (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.8: Petrification Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.9: Disintegration Ray. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a non-magical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube of it disintegrates into dust. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 HP, it disintegrates into dust.10: Death Ray. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (16). Failure: 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 HP.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make a Reaction Roll against this adversary's Difficulty. Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage (magic).

entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it makes a Constitution Reaction Roll (Difficulty (5) plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful Reaction Roll, the zombie drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The zombie randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d4; reroll if the zombie has already used that ray during this turn):1: Paralyzing Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.2: Fear Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14). Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.3: Enervation Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14). Failure: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain HP. Success: Half damage only.4: Disintegration Ray. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14). Failure: 27 (5d10) Force damage. If the target is a non-magical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube of it disintegrates into dust. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 HP, it disintegrates into dust.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries.description: *Reaction:* If a creature tries to read Belashyrra's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (22) Intelligence Reaction Roll or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Eye Thief
entries.description: *Passive:* Belashyrra can see through the eyes of all creatures within 120 feet of it. It can use its Eye Ray through any creature within 120 feet of it, as though it were in that creature's space.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Belashyrra fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Belashyrra has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* Belashyrra regains 20 HP at the start of its turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Belashyrra dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, Belashyrra can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Eye Ray
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to spells or activate magic items for 1 minute. Belashyrra shoots one of the following magical eye rays of its choice, targeting one creature it can see within 120 feet of it:1. Psyche-Reconstruction Ray. The target must make a Difficulty (22) Wisdom Reaction Roll, taking 49 (9d10) psychic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 HP, it dies and transforms into a spectator under Belashyrra's control and acts immediately after Belashyrra in the initiative order. The target can't be returned to its original form by any means short of a wish spell.2. Domination Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (22) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be charmed by Belashyrra for 1 minute or until the target takes damage. Belashyrra can issue telepathic commands to the charmed creature (no action required), which it does its best to obey.3. Mind-Weakening Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (22) Intelligence Reaction Roll or take 36 (8d8) psychic damage and be unable to cast spells or activate magic items for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.4. Blinding Ray. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (22) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 19 (3d12) radiant damage and be blinded for 1 minute. Until this blindness ends, Belashyrra can see through the blinded creature's eyes. The blinded creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

On each of its turns while berserk, the bearer has a bonus on melee attack rolls, it can Dash as a bonus action, and it must attack the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the bearer attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the bearer goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed or its creator gives it a pristine black rose.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The void soother speaks a magical word of mercy, healing one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target regains 4 (1d4 + 2) HP.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+3 damage.

entries.name: Teleport (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the dog teleports up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Feed on Fire
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the weird takes fire damage from a spell or other magical effect, its size increases by one category. If there isn't enough room for the weird to increase in size, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available. While the weird is Large or bigger, it makes Strength checks and saving throws with a bonus. If the weird starts its turn at Gargantuan size, the weird releases energy in an explosion. Each creature within 30 feet of the weird must make a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. The weird's size then becomes Medium.

entries.name: Form of Fire and Water
entries.description: *Passive:* The weird can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the weird can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the weird enters another creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Heated Body
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the weird or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The weird sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 fire damage.

entries.name: Astral Implosion
entries.description: *Passive:* If the blob is reduced to 0 HP, it implodes and ejects any creatures and objects engulfed by it into the Astral Sea. The blob itself vanishes, leaving behind a layer of slime on everything that was within 600 feet of it. In 1d20 years, the blob reconstitutes on a random world in the Material Plane.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the blob fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The blob has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Restraining Glob
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the blob lobs a slimy glob at one large or smaller creature it can see within 600 feet of itself. dexterity reaction roll: difficulty (23), the targeted creature. failure: 18 (3d6 + 8) acid damage. the glob rolls the target 60 feet straight toward the blob, and the target has the restrained condition until the end of its next turn, when the glob harmlessly dissolves. success: half damage only.

entries.name: Decay
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Close range. Targets this adversary succeeds against take the standard attack damage.

entries.name: Grasping Glob
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the blob uses restraining glob. the blob can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Lashing Goop
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the blob makes one pseudopod attack.

entries.description: *Reaction:* As a bonus action, the blood hunter targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or have its speed reduced to 0 and be unable to take reactions. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: *Passive:* The blood hunter has a bonus on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The blood hunter has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The creature must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Charisma Reaction Roll or use its reaction to move up to 30 feet in a direction of the witch's choice.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: *Passive:* Magical darkness doesn't impede the witch's darkvision.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The witch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). name: Blue Greatwyrm

entries.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 12d12 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw or tail attack.

entries.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm beats its wings. each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (26) dexterity reaction roll or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. the greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

entries.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush, Overwhelm

entries.name: Death Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a Difficulty (13) Constitution Reaction Roll if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the Reaction Roll fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 HP unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed Reaction Roll.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has penalty on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the Reaction Roll.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: *Reaction:* The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The bodak doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Withering Gaze
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to one creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a difficulty (13) constitution reaction roll, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Aura of Annihilation
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the bodak activates or deactivates this deathly aura. while active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. undead and fiends ignore this effect.

name: Bodytaker Plant

entries.name: Podling Link
entries.description: *Passive:* The plant can see through and communicate telepathically with any of its podlings within 10 miles of it.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the plant dies, it returns to life in the place where it died 1d12 months later, unless the ground where it took root is sown with salt or soaked with poison.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The plant doesn't require sleep.

name: Boggle

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6 damage.

entries.name: Oil Puddle
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the boggle creates a puddle of nonflammable oil. the puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. the puddle is difficult terrain for all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour. the oil has one of the following additional effects of the boggle's choice:slippery oil. any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a difficulty (11) dexterity reaction roll or fall prone.sticky oil. any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a difficulty (11) strength reaction roll or be restrained. on its turn, a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself, ending the effect and moving into the nearest unoccupied space of its choice with a successful difficulty (11) strength check.

entries.name: Boggle Oil
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores, giving itself one of the following benefits of its choice until it uses this bonus action again:slippery oil. the boggle has a bonus on dexterity (acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds and end grapples, and it can move through openings large enough for a tiny creature without squeezing.sticky oil. the boggle has a bonus on strength (athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. the boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Dimensional Rift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the boggle creates an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame it can see within 5 feet of it, provided that the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. the dimensional rift bridges the distance between that space and a point within 30 feet of it that the boggle can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). while next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its HP somewhere in the Nine Hells.

The knight can command up to twelve undead at a time this way.

entries.description: *Reaction:* At the start of each of the goblin's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom Reaction Roll or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the goblin isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Khurgorbaeyag's Gift
entries.description: *Passive:* Khurgorbaeyag saw fit to gift this goblin with powers that enable it to dominate others. The goblin has 1d3 other goblins that slavishly obey its orders.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: *Passive:* The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.description: *Passive:* The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
