entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Borborygmos fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries.description: *Passive:* Borborygmos has penalty on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* Borborygmos deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to each creature of borborygmos's choice that is within 60 feet of him and can see or hear him must succeed on a difficulty (17) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened of him for 1 minute. the frightened creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a creature's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to borborygmos's frightful presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to borborygmos makes a weapon attack.

entries.name: Bellow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to borborygmos yells menacingly at one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. that creature must succeed on a difficulty (17) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened of him for 1 minute. if the creature is already frightened, it becomes stunned instead. a creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a creature's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to borborygmos's bellow for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Wide Berth (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to borborygmos moves up to half his speed and can move through the space of any creature smaller than huge. the first time borborygmos enters a creature's space during this move, the creature must make a difficulty (21) dexterity reaction roll. if the reaction roll succeeds, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from borborygmos. if the reaction roll fails, that creature is knocked prone, and borborygmos can make a stomp attack against it.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The worm regains 10 HP at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: *Passive:* The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Hustle
entries.description: *Passive:* The smuggler can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size, but it can't stop there.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d6+2 poison damage.

entries.name: Pistol
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d10+2 damage.

entries.name: Hustle
entries.description: *Passive:* The underboss can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size, but it can't stop there.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Glacial Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* At the end of the borthak's turn, slippery ice covers surfaces within 10 feet of the borthak. This ice is difficult terrain. When a creature other than the borthak enters the ice's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Dexterity Reaction Roll or have the prone condition. The ice disappears at the start of the borthak's next turn.

entries.name: Webbed Feet
entries.description: *Passive:* The borthak can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (acid).

entries.name: Noxious Regurgitation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the borthak spews acid at a creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. the target must make a difficulty (21) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the creature takes 24 (7d6) acid damage and has the poisoned condition until the start of the borthak's next turn. on a successful reaction roll, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Move
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the borthak moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the borthak makes one bite attack.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: *Passive:* Augustus wields a +2 Longsword.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* Augustus regains 10 HP at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Augustus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to augustus polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid hybrid, a wolf, or his humanoid form. his statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form. any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. he reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to augustus takes the dash, disengage, or hide action.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Delour is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries.description: *Passive:* Delour can move through the space of a Medium or larger creature.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* Delour regains 10 HP at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Delour dies only if he starts his turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to delour polymorphs into a rat-humanoid hybrid, a medium giant rat, or his humanoid form. his statistics, other than his size and speed, are the same in each form. any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. he reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to delour takes the dash, disengage, or hide action.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian is reduced to 0 HP, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away, and then its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (10) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)):1/day each: enlarge/reduce, invisibility, stinking cloud, web

entries.name: Fungal Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the trudge to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the trudge drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Tusk
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d10+5 poison damage.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain breaker is aware of creatures within 1 mile of itself that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain breaker has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain breaker can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The brain breaker can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The brain breaker casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 3d8+2 psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to creatures of the brain breaker's choice within 60 feet of itself must succeed on a difficulty (17) intelligence reaction roll or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. a stunned creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Psychic Link
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the brain breaker targets one creature with the incapacitated condition that the brain breaker senses with its creature sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. until the link ends, the brain breaker can perceive everything the target senses. the target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it no longer has the incapacitated condition, and the brain breaker can terminate the link at any time (no action required). the target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful difficulty (17) charisma check. if the target breaks the link this way, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. the link also ends if the target and the brain breaker are more than 1 mile apart. the brain breaker can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Detect Sentience
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), detect thoughts, mage hand, zone of truth3/day each: charm person, hold person1/day each: compulsion, hold monster, sleep (3rd-level version), Tasha's hideous laughter

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The brain doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 3d8 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 3d8+4 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

name: Brass Dragon Wyrmling

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d10+2 damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale fire in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (11). Targets who fail take 4d6 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Sleep Breath
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a Far range cone. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (11). Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage.

motives_tactics: Burn enemies, Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Ambush

name: Brass Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 4 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 HP or uses its action to end it.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw or tail attack.

entries.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm beats its wings. each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (26) dexterity reaction roll or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. the greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

motives_tactics: Burn enemies, Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush
original_cr: 28 (XP 120,000, or 240,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Intellect Fortress
entries.description: *Passive:* The braxat's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale acid in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 4d12 acid damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The braxat casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)):1/day each: compulsion, fear

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Flame Aura
entries.description: *Passive:* At the end of each of the gorgon's turns, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the gorgon takes 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The gorgon sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (fire).

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The breath drinker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Radiant Absorption
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the breath drinker is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the radiant damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Drink Breath
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a Far range area. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 8d8 necrotic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a area of Medium range. All targets within that area must make a Reaction Roll against this adversary's Difficulty. Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage.

entries.name: Fungus Stride
entries.description: *Passive:* Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within 5 feet and emerge from another within 60 feet of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (10) constitution reaction roll or be poisoned for 1 minute. while poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. the target can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a difficulty (10) constitution reaction roll. on a successful reaction roll, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. on a failed reaction roll, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the madness of zuggtmoy table in appendix d) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. while infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the reaction roll at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. on a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "myconids" entry in the monster manual).

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: *Passive:* The brigganock has a bonus on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Soul Light
entries.description: *Passive:* The brigganock is accompanied by an insubstantial, invulnerable ball of light that contains its soul. The brigganock can't turn off the light or control its brightness. The soul light sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If the brigganock dies, its soul light fades away.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: *Passive:* Using a pickaxe or similar tool, a brigganock can burrow through solid rock at a speed of 5 feet, leaving a 6-inch-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Pickaxe
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The brigganock casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (11)):At will: minor illusion, spare the dying1/day each: animal friendship, faerie fire, meld into stone, silence

entries.name: Time Lapse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the brigganock accelerates the passage of time around itself, enabling it to accomplish up to 1 hour of work in a matter of seconds. this work can't affect any creature other than the brigganock, or any object being worn or carried by another creature, and the activity must take place within a 10-foot cube. for example, the brigganock could use this action to rapidly carve a pumpkin, cook and eat dinner, move a pile of stones, or tie a dozen knots in a length of rope.

entries.name: Move Soul Light
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the brigganock moves its soul light up to 30 feet in any direction to an unoccupied space it can see. at the end of the current turn, the light returns to the brigganock.

entries.name: Bladed Hide
entries.description: *Passive:* At the start of each of its turns, the moorbounder deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: *Passive:* The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Antigonos moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

entries.name: Decrepit State
entries.description: *Passive:* Antigonos has penalty on his attack rolls.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: *Passive:* Antigonos can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: *Passive:* At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain bonus on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d12+4 damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+4 damage.

entries.name: Amphora
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d8+4 poison damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 5d8+5 damage.

entries.name: Tail

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Soul Swap
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to on the controlled body drives the carrionette out and returns the consciousness of both creatures to their original bodies. The carrionette targets a creature it can see within 15 feet of it that is cursed by its Silver Needle. Unless the target is protected by a protection from evil and good spell, it must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Charisma Reaction Roll or have its consciousness swapped with the carrionette. The carrionette gains control of the target's body, and the target is unconscious for 1 hour, after which it gains control of the carrionette's body. While controlling the target's body, the carrionette retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It otherwise uses the controlled body's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.If the carrionette's body is destroyed, both the carrionette and the target die. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the controlled body drives the carrionette out and returns the consciousness of both creatures to their original bodies. The swap is also undone if the controlled body takes damage from the carrionette's Silver Needle.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. a creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape difficulty (13)), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have penalty. the filament can be attacked (ac 15; 5 hp; immunity to poison and psychic damage). a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful difficulty (13) strength check to pull free. destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. the filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

name: Centaur Mummy

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: *Passive:* If the centaur mummy moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The centaur mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, the target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the Reaction Roll by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the Reaction Roll is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Mushroom Portal
entries.description: *Passive:* The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

entries.name: Poison Spores
entries.description: *Reaction:* Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within 5 feet of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Constitution Reaction Roll or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the chamberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a difficulty (12) constitution reaction roll. on a successful reaction roll, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. on a failed reaction roll, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the madness of zuggtmoy table in appendix d) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. while infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the reaction roll at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. on a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "myconids" entry in the monster manual).

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.description: *Reaction:* The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within 5 feet of it. the target gains a supernatural charm of the dm's choice. see chapter 7 of the dungeon masters guide for more information on supernatural charms.

entries.name: Natural Shelter
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to be berserk until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

The mask regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a cloud rune on a mask in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw or tail attack.

entries.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm beats its wings. each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (26) dexterity reaction roll or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. the greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

entries.name: Pack Tactics

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: *Passive:* The seer can traverse through non-magical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the seer doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Magic Resistance

entries.name: Harass

entries.name: Radiant Mirror
entries.description: *Passive:* If the worm takes radiant damage, each creature within 20 feet of it takes that damage as well.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: *Passive:* The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Relentless (2)

entries.name: Corpses
entries.description: *Reaction:* When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Stench of Death
entries.description: *Reaction:* Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll, unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Harvest the Dead
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the corpse flower swallows one unsecured humanoid corpse within 10 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Digest
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the corpse flower digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hp. nothing of the digested corpse remains. any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

entries.name: Reanimate
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the corpse flower animates one corpse in its body, turning it into a zombie. the zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. the zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see stench of death).

entries.name: Immutable Form

entries.name: Light Intensity
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the illuminated golem and can see the golem must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be blinded until the start of the creature's next turn.A creature can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the golem until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the golem in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (25). Targets who fail take 11d12 magic damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. no one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. each targeted creature must succeed on a difficulty (26) strength reaction roll or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. at the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.at the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. in addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 HP or uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

entries.name: Claw

entries.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 5d10 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.description: *Passive:* The raider has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the raider's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+3 damage.

entries.name: Physical Restraint
entries.description: *Passive:* The dabus doesn't make melee attacks or opportunity attacks, even in self-defense.

entries.name: Symbol Speech
entries.description: *Passive:* A dabus communicates by creating illusory symbols and pictures that float in the air in front of itself and disappear a few seconds later. A creature that can see such a message can decipher it with a successful Difficulty (10) Intelligence (Investigation) check (no action required).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Grasping Ground (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The dabus causes a 20-foot-square area of ground it can see within 60 feet of itself to sprout clutching appendages made of stone. Each creature of the dabus's choice in that area must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and have the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). While grappled in this way, the creature has the restrained condition. The appendages vanish after 1 minute or if the dabus's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Pact of Pain
entries.description: *Reaction:* Using a 10-minute ritual, the daemogoth can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the daemogoth dies, or the pact is broken by any effect that can remove a curse.The daemogoth chooses one spell from the necromancy or enchantment school that is 3rd level or lower. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's concentration on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Terrify (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the daemogoth targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. the target must make a difficulty (17) wisdom reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the target takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the daemogoth until the end of the daemogoth's next turn, and the daemogoth regains 5 hp. on a successful reaction roll, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened, and the daemogoth doesn't heal.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the titan fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Pact of Suffering
entries.description: *Reaction:* Using a 10-minute long ritual, the titan can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the titan dies, or the pact is broken by a wish spell.The titan chooses one spell from the necromancy or enchantment school that is 8th level or lower. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 21 (6d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's concentration on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the titan teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the titan makes one agonizing burst attack.

entries.name: Stalking Nightmare (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the titan uses teleport, after which it can target one creature within 20 feet of itself that it can see. the target must make a difficulty (20) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the target takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage, and the titan regains 10 hp. on a successful reaction roll, the target takes half as much damage, and the titan doesn't heal.

entries.name: Terrorize (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the titan targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. the target must make a difficulty (20) wisdom reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the target takes 38 (7d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the titan until the end of the target's next turn, and the titan regains 15 hp. on a successful reaction roll, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened, and the titan doesn't heal.

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: *Passive:* If the golem takes fire damage, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP.The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 HP or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+4 damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Dancing Flame

entries.name: Flame
entries.description: *Passive:* The flame sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If it leaves the hall or is reduced to 0 HP, it is destroyed and can't re-form for 24 hours.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: *Reaction:* The flame ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 fire damage.

entries.name: Charm
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. One humanoid the flame can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the flame's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this flame's Charm for the next 24 hours.The flame can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

entries.name: Draining Kiss
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The flame kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a Difficulty (15) Constitution Reaction Roll against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

entries.description: *Reaction:* When any creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the item, the item can increase or decrease (your choice) the walking speed of that creature by 10 feet until the end of the turn, provided the item isn't incapacitated.

entries.description: *Passive:* The dao can burrow through non-magical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the dao dies outside the Elemental Plane of Earth, its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its HP somewhere on the Plane of Earth.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The dao has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: *Passive:* The dao has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the dao knows it, the dao can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the dao can understand. If the dao casts the spell for the creature, the dao suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the dao has cast it three times, the dao can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Dark Tide Knight

entries.name: Bonded Mount
entries.description: *Passive:* The knight is magically bound to a beast with an innate swimming speed trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on this beast, the knight gains the beast's senses and ability to breathe underwater. The bonded mount obeys the knight's commands. If its mount dies, the knight can train a new beast to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

entries.name: Sneak Attack
entries.description: *Reaction:* The knight deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has a bonus on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the knight that isn't incapacitated and the knight doesn't have penalty on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When the darkling dies, non-magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must succeed on a Difficulty (10) Constitution Reaction Roll or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: *Passive:* While in bright light, the darkling has penalty on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+3 necrotic damage.

Any creature in that area must make a Difficulty (11) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 necrotic damage.

entries.description: *Passive:* The darkweaver can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: *Reaction:* The darkweaver takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Far range. Targets this adversary succeeds against take the standard attack damage.

entries.name: Culling Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (20), each Bloodied creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the scion at the end of the scion's turn. Failure: The target can't regain HP until the start of the scion's next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)

entries.name: Olach Morrah
entries.description: *Passive:* The giant meditates for 1 hour, during which time it can do nothing else. At the end of the hour, provided the giant's meditation has been uninterrupted, it becomes petrified for 8 hours. At the end of this time, the giant is no longer petrified and gains tremorsense out to a range of 30 feet, as well as a measure of innate spellcasting ability for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: *Passive:* The giant has a bonus on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Petrifying Tendrils
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn in the death embrace's space must make a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature is restrained. A creature restrained in this way must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failed Reaction Roll or ending the effect on a successful one. The petrified condition lasts until the effect is ended by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: *Passive:* At the start of each of its turns, the death embrace can pull each creature it is grappling up to 20 feet toward it (no action required).

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: *Passive:* The death embrace can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Frightening Teleport (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The giant magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the location the giant left must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Wisdom Reaction Roll or have the frightened condition until the end of that creature's next turn.

entries.name: Death Rune
entries.description: *Reaction:* The giant has a death rune inscribed on a giant's skull in its possession. While holding or wearing the skull bearing the rune, the giant can use its Reaping Scythe action and Shroud of Souls bonus action.The skull bearing the death rune has AC 18; 35 HP; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The skull regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a death rune on another skull in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The giant magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. entries.name: Shroud of Souls (Requires Death Rune)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the giant shrouds itself in a torrent of souls. while the giant is shrouded, each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a difficulty (19) wisdom reaction roll or have penalty on saving throws until the end of that creature's next turn. the shroud disappears after 1 minute, when the giant dies, when the giant uses this bonus action again, or when the giant's death rune is destroyed.

entries.description: *Passive:* If the death knight is destroyed before it atones for its evil, it gains a new body in 1d10 days, reviving with all its HP. The new body appears in a location significant to the death knight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The death tyrant randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the death tyrant has already used that ray during this turn):1: Charm Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. Success: Half damage only.2: Paralyzing Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.3: Fear Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.4: Slowing Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. Success: Half damage only.5: Enervation Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 16 (3d10) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain HP. Success: Half damage only.6: Telekinetic Ray. Strength Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17) (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). Failure: The death tyrant moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant has the Incapacitated condition. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.7: Sleep Ray. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17) (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.8: Petrification Ray. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.9: Disintegration Ray. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a non-magical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube of it disintegrates into dust. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 HP, it disintegrates into dust.10: Death Ray. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17). Failure: 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 HP.

entries.name: Delightful Light (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make a Reaction Roll against this adversary's Difficulty. Targets who fail take 2d10 magic damage.

entries.name: Fey Leap
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the dolphin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. immediately before teleporting, the dolphin can choose one creature within 5 feet of it. that creature can teleport with the dolphin, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dolphin's destination space.

entries.name: Mechanical Determination
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the wonder to 0 HP, it makes a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Lightning or from a Critical Hit. On a successful Reaction Roll, the wonder drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

entries.name: Wind-Up Operation
entries.description: *Passive:* The wonder has the Unconscious condition until another creature winds it with the wonder's unique key for 1 minute. Once wound, the wonder operates for 10 days or until a creature touches the wonder with its key as a Utilize action to deactivate it, after which the wonder has the Unconscious condition until it is wound again.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Aura of Doom
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the doom lord must make a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the doom lord doesn't have the incapacitated condition, it can suppress or resume this aura at the start of its turn (no action required).

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* The doom lord deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Aura of Erebos
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Constitution Reaction Roll, or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain HP until the start of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The giant has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 8d8 necrotic damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Read Thoughts
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The doppelganger casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d6+4 damage.

entries.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (12). Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage and have the Frightened condition until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the doppelganger shape-shifts into a medium or small humanoid, or it returns to its true form. its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: *Passive:* The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has a bonus on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.Whenever the dracohydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the dracohydra dies.At the end of its turn, the dracohydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn. The dracohydra regains 10 HP for each head regrown this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: *Passive:* While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (fire).

entries.name: Prismatic Breath (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (17). Targets who fail take 6d10 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the dracolich fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Life Suppression
entries.description: *Passive:* Creatures within 60 feet of the dracolich can't regain HP.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The dracolich has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Gem
entries.description: *Passive:* The dracolich has a magical gem. If the dracolich is destroyed while the gem is on the same plane of existence as it, the dracolich gains a new body in 1d20 days, regaining all its HP and appearing within 5 feet of the gem.The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP. If the gem is destroyed, the dracolich can create a new one by completing an 8-hour ritual using a gem worth 1,000+ GP and by expending 5,000 GP, which the ritual consumes.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the dracolich moves up to half its speed, and it makes one rend attack.

entries.name: Sickening Ray
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to Ray of Sickness (level 2 version). The dracolich uses Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness (level 2 version). The dracolich can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Presence
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take 2d10 psychic damage and have the Frightened condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

name: Draconian Dreadnought

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian is reduced to 0 HP, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian is reduced to 0 HP, its body turns to stone and releases a petrifying gas. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a Difficulty (11) Constitution Reaction Roll or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends; otherwise the creature is petrified for 1 minute. After 1 minute, the body of the draconian crumbles to dust.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Death Throes

Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

entries.name: Death Throes

Each creature must make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

entries.description: *Passive:* The shard's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The shard can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the shard fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Reaction:* When it drops to 0 HP, the shard disappears and leaves a Tiny cracked gemstone in its space. The gemstone matches the kind of gem dragon it was in life and has AC 20, 15 HP, and immunity to all damage except force. Unless the gemstone is destroyed, after 1d20 days, the gemstone dissipates and the shard re-forms, regaining all its HP and appearing in the place the gemstone once occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The shard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Telekinetic Rend
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+6 magic damage.

entries.name: Inhabit Object
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to spells, and use its legendary actions. The shard disappears as it pours its psychic essence into a Medium or smaller nonsentient object it can see within 30 feet of it, magically possessing it. The object uses the shard's AC, and any damage dealt to the object applies to the shard's HP. The shard inhabits the object until it uses an action to leave; until it is turned; until it is reduced to 0 HP; or until an effect that ends possession, such as a dispel evil and good spell, is used on it. When it leaves the object, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.While inhabited, the object becomes a magic item if it wasn't already, and a Tiny cracked gemstone matching the kind of gem dragon the shard was in life appears somewhere on the object. The shard can cause the object to fly using the shard's own flying speed, use its senses, speak verbally or telepathically, cast spells, and use its legendary actions.If a creature wears or carries the inhabited object, the shard can grant the creature the following benefits:Each of the creature's attacks deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.The creature gains resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Psychic Crush (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (20). Targets who fail take 10d10 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The shard uses Spellcasting.

entries.name: Commanding Thought (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the shard targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (20) wisdom reaction roll or be charmed until the end of its next turn. while charmed in this way, the target becomes the shard's puppet, acting and moving in accordance with its telepathic commands. while under the shard's control, the target can take only the attack (shard chooses the target) or dash action on its turn.

entries.description: *Passive:* Once per turn, if the dragonfang makes a weapon attack with a bonus on the attack roll and hits, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

entries.name: Limited Flight
entries.description: *Passive:* The dragonfang can use a bonus action to gain a flying speed of 30 feet until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The dragonfang has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dragonfang's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The abomination regains 10 HP at the start of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the dread warrior to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the dread warrior drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Mind Curse
entries.description: *Reaction:* Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (15), one creature hit by the infiltrator's Mind Blade attack this turn. Failure: The target takes 14 (4d6) Psychic damage and is cursed. While cursed in this way, it has penalty on attack rolls against the infiltrator, and the infiltrator always knows its location while it and the infiltrator are on the same plane of existence. A cursed creature repeats the Reaction Roll whenever it finishes a Short or Long Rest, ending the effect on itself on a success. Success: Half damage only.

Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying in Humanoid form melds into the spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to its Humanoid form if it dies.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude

name: Dullahan

entries.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the dullahan is reduced to 0 HP, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 HP. In addition, it summons three death's heads, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.
