entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (10). Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage and have the Blinded condition until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Sleep (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The mephit casts the Sleep spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (10)).

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: *Passive:* The skeleton has a bonus on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that make it have the prone condition.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 damage.

name: Dybbuk

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The dybbuk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The dybbuk has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The dybbuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)):At will: dimension door3/day: phantasmal force

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+4 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Possess Corpse (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the dybbuk disappears into an intact corpse within 5 feet of it that belonged to a large or smaller beast or humanoid. the dybbuk gains 20 temporary hp. while possessing the corpse, the dybbuk adopts the corpse's size and can't use incorporeal movement. its game statistics otherwise remain the same. the possession lasts until the temporary hp are lost or the dybbuk ends it as a bonus action. when the possession ends, the dybbuk appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse.

entries.name: Control Corpse
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to while possess corpse is active, the dybbuk makes the corpse do something unnatural, such as vomit blood, twist its head all the way around, or cause a quadruped to move as a biped. any beast or humanoid that sees this behavior must succeed on a difficulty (12) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened of the dybbuk for 1 minute. the frightened creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. a creature that succeeds on a reaction roll against this ability is immune to control corpse for 24 hours.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries.description: *Reaction:* If a creature tries to read Dyrrn's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (23) Intelligence Reaction Roll or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Dyrrn fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Dyrrn has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* Dyrrn regains 20 HP at the start of its turn. If Dyrrn takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Dyrrn dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, Dyrrn can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Tentacle Whip
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to dyrrn makes one attack with its tentacle whip.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to dyrrn regurgitates an intellect devourer in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. the intellect devourer is under dyrrn's control and acts immediately after dyrrn in the initiative order.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (23). Targets who fail take 5d8+8 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

name: Eater of Hope

entries.name: Insatiable Greed
entries.description: *Passive:* The eater of hope can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The eater of hope has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The eater of knowledge has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The eater of knowledge casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15)). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:1/day each: plane shift (self only, 0 brains), detect magic (1 brain), silent image (2 brains), invisibility (3 brains), hypnotic pattern (4 brains), major image (5 brains), telekinesis (6 brains), arcane eye (7 brains), mislead (8 brains), greater invisibility (9 brains), mass suggestion (10 or more brains)

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the efreeti dies outside the Elemental Plane of Fire, its body dissolves into ash, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its HP somewhere on the Plane of Fire.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The efreeti has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: *Passive:* The efreeti has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the efreeti knows it, the efreeti can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the efreeti can understand. If the efreeti casts the spell for the creature, the efreeti suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the efreeti has cast it three times, the efreeti can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack

Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the egg hunter move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the egg hunter is animate. Dragons have penalty on this check.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object other than a sacred statue.

entries.name: Sacred Animation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the eidolon moves into a space occupied by a sacred statue, the eidolon can disappear, causing the statue to become a creature under the eidolon's control. The eidolon uses the sacred statue's stat block in place of its own.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The eidolon has a bonus on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The eidolon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Divine Dread
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to each creature within 60 feet of the eidolon that can see it must succeed on a difficulty (15) wisdom reaction roll or be frightened of it for 1 minute. while frightened in this way, the creature must take the dash action and move away from the eidolon by the safest available route at the start of each of its turns, unless there is nowhere for it to move, in which case the creature also becomes stunned until it can move again. a frightened target can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a target's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any eidolon's divine dread for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any non-magical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 acid damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The elder brain is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the elder brain fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The elder brain has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: *Passive:* The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The elder brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate3/day: modify memory1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 4d8+2 psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (18) intelligence reaction roll or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. a target can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Psychic Link
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain targets one incapacitated creature it senses with its creature sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. until the link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. the target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer incapacitated, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). the target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful difficulty (18) charisma reaction roll. on a successful reaction roll, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. the link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart. the elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

entries.name: Sense Thoughts
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. the elder brain gains insight into the target's emotional state and foremost thoughts (including worries, loves, and hates).

entries.name: Break Concentration
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 2 (1d4) psychic damage per level of the spell.

entries.name: Psychic Pulse
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. the target and enemies of the elder brain within 30 feet of target take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Sever Psychic Link
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. the elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have penalty on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Tentacle (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain makes one tentacle attack.

entries.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the oblex extrudes a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. this simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. the oblex can impersonate 2d6 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. the simulacrum is an extension of the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. the tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex and the simulacrum. the simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes penalty on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose penalty on ranged attack rolls. They also extinguish open flames and disperse fog.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

name: Emerald Greatwyrm

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (25). Targets who fail take 11d12 magic damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. no one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. each targeted creature must succeed on a difficulty (26) strength reaction roll or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. at the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.at the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. in addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 HP or uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw attack.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 5d10 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush, Overwhelm

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The gemmule has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 3d10 psychic damage.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gemmule targets one creature within 5 feet of itself and forces the target to make a difficulty (14) dexterity reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the gemmule enters the target's space and attaches to the target. while the gemmule is attached, the target takes 7 (3d4) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the gemmule can't use leech again until it detaches. it can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. as an action, the target or a creature within 5 feet of the target can detach the gemmule by succeeding on a difficulty (15) strength check.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the infiltrator fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.description: *Passive:* The infiltrator's AC includes its Wisdom modifier, and the infiltrator can't be targeted by divination magic or features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The infiltrator magically whispers to a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll or have the stunned condition due to fear or delight (the infiltrator's choice) until the end of the target's next turn, after which the target is immune to this Beguiling Whisper for 24 hours.

entries.name: Cunning
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The infiltrator escapes non-magical restraints and ends the grappled condition on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the infiltrator makes one poison blade attack.

entries.name: Misdirecting Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The infiltrator magically has the invisible condition and creates an illusory duplicate of itself in its space, then teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 15 feet of itself. The image flings illusory blades at two creatures of the infiltrator's choice within 20 feet of the image. Each target must make a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll, taking 13 (3d8) psychic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The invisibility lasts until the end of the infiltrator's next turn.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the erinyes dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its HP somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The erinyes has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.description: *Reaction:* The erinyes has a magic rope. While bearing it, the erinyes can use the Entangling Rope action. The rope has AC 20, HP 90, and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The rope turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP, if it is 5+ feet away from the erinyes for 1 hour or more, or if the erinyes dies. If the rope is damaged or destroyed, the erinyes can fully restore it when finishing a Short or Long Rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.description: *Passive:* The esthetic has the properties of a spelljamming helm (see the Astral Adventurer's Guide), but only its reigar creator can attune to it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The esthetic doesn't require air, food, or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The esthetic targets one spelljamming ship within 300 feet of itself, magically suppressing the properties of the ship's spelljamming helm for 2d10 days. If the ship has more than one helm aboard it, randomly determine which helm is affected. A creature attuned to that helm can choose to make a Difficulty (17) Charisma Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 42 (12d6) psychic damage, and the helm is suppressed for 2d10 hours instead of 2d10 days. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature takes half as much damage, and the helm is suppressed for 2d10 minutes instead of 2d10 days.

entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, the guard can wreath one melee weapon it is wielding in flame. The guard is unharmed by this fire, which lasts until the end of the guard's next turn. While wreathed in flame, the weapon deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit.

entries.name: Antimagic Gullet
entries.description: *Action:* Magical effects, including those produced by spells and magic items but excluding those created by artifacts or deities, are suppressed inside the eye monger's gullet. Any spell slot or charge expended by a creature in the gullet to cast a spell or activate a property of a magic item is wasted. While an effect is suppressed, it doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration. No spell or magical effect that originates outside the eye monger's gullet, except one created by an artifact or a deity, can affect a creature or an object inside the gullet.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the eye monger is motionless and has its eye and mouth closed at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the eye monger move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the eye monger is animate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The eye monger doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+5 acid damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Antimagic Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 6d12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it:1: Freezing Ray. The target must make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target takes 17 (5d6) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target takes half as much damage with no additional effects.2: Debilitating Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and become incapacitated until the end of its next turn.3: Repulsion Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or take 14 (4d6) force damage and be pushed up to 60 feet away from the eyedrake.4: Fire Ray. The target must make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.5: Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.6: Death Ray. The target must make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 28 (8d6) necrotic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 HP.

entries.name: Bloodcurdling Lament (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the false lich emits a hideous shriek charged with malignant energy. each creature within 30 feet of the false lich must succeed on a difficulty (22) wisdom reaction roll or have the frightened condition for 1 minute. while frightened in this way, a creature also has the unconscious condition. an affected creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting

The false lich casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (22)):At will: Detect Magic, Fly, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation3/day each: Dispel Magic, Invisibility (self only)1/day each: Globe of Invulnerability, Hold Monster

entries.name: Soul Siphon
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the false lich targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. the target must make a difficulty (22) charisma reaction roll; if the target has the unconscious condition, it has penalty on this reaction roll. the target takes 21 (6d6) force damage on a failed reaction roll or half as much damage on a successful one. the false lich then regains a number of hp equal to the amount of force damage taken.if this damage reduces the target to 0 hp, the target immediately dies, its body disappears, and its soul is trapped inside one of the soul gems within the false lich's skull. after 24 hours, the gem transfers the soul to the false lich's creator.when the false lich is reduced to 0 hp, it is destroyed and disintegrates, leaving behind the gems. crushing a gem releases any souls trapped within, at which point the soul's body re-forms in an unoccupied space nearest to the gem and in the same state as it was when its soul was trapped.

entries.name: Spiteful Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the false lich, along with anything it is wearing or carrying, teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of itself. it then makes one death rend attack if possible.

entries.name: Destined Jaunt
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The hag magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself.

entries.name: Tangle Threads
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The hag magically tangles a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself in spectral silver threads. The creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Destiny Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The hag magically curses a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The creature must make a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll, and the creature has penalty on this Reaction Roll if it has damaged the hag within the last minute. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature has penalty on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the curse ends. Once per turn, when the cursed creature fails one of those d20 rolls, it takes 7 (2d6) force damage. The curse ends after 1 minute; when the creature succeeds on a total of three ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws in any combination; or when the hag uses this action again.

entries.name: Commanding Words
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The shaker speaks magical words to order a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be affected by one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d4):1-2: Grovel. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, drops whatever it is holding, and has the prone condition.3-4: Cower. The target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Shapechanger (2/Day)
entries.description: *Passive:* The fathomer can use its action to polymorph into a Medium serpent composed of water, or back into its true form. Anything the fathomer is wearing or carrying is subsumed into the serpent form during the change, inaccessible until the fathomer returns to its true form. The fathomer reverts to its true form after 4 hours, unless it can expend another use of this trait. If the fathomer is knocked unconscious or dies, it also reverts to its true form.While in serpent form, the fathomer gains a swimming speed of 40 feet, the ability to breathe underwater, immunity to poison damage, as well as resistance to fire damage and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks. It also has immunity to the following conditions: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious. The serpent form can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if water can pass through a space, the serpent can do so without squeezing.

entries.name: Olhydra's Armor (Human Form Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* The fathomer can cast mage armor at will, without expending material components.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Human Form Only)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The fathomer is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has two 3rd-level spell slots, which it regains after finishing a short or long rest, and knows the following warlock spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, mage hand1st-3rd level (2 3rd-level slots): armor of Agathys, expeditious retreat, hex, invisibility, Vampiric touch

entries.name: Bonding
entries.description: *Action:* The felidar can magically bond with one creature it can see, right after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the felidar bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. This bond has the following effects: The felidar and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet. The felidar can sense the direction and distance to the bonded creature if they're on the same plane of existence. As an action, the felidar or the bonded creature can sense what the other sees and hears, during which time it loses its own sight and hearing. This effect lasts until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight

If the target is prone, the felidar can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

At the end of every hour, the creature must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Charisma Reaction Roll or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Regeneration

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem starts its turn with 100 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP. If the golem's creator is within 60 feet of the berserk golem, the creator can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 100 HP or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Fire Rune
entries.description: *Reaction:* The giant has a fire rune inscribed on a medallion or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Magma Wave action and Furnace Armor bonus action.The object bearing the rune has AC 15; 40 HP; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a fire rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the colossus attacks an object. Once the colossus goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed.

entries.description: *Passive:* The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.description: *Passive:* If the golem takes Fire damage, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem starts its turn Bloodied, roll 1d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object. Once the golem goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by taking an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of HP equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance

entries.description: *Passive:* The flesh meld can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Consume Creature
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the flesh meld targets one large or smaller creature within 5 feet of itself that it's grappling. the target must succeed on a difficulty (15) dexterity reaction roll or be swallowed by the flesh meld. the flesh meld can have one creature swallowed at a time.a swallowed creature no longer has the grappled condition. while swallowed, it has the blinded and restrained conditions, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the flesh meld, and takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the flesh meld's turns. if this damage reduces a swallowed creature to 0 hp, the creature dies, and the flesh meld consumes its body.if the flesh meld takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the flesh meld must succeed on a difficulty (15) constitution reaction roll at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls with the prone condition in a space within 5 feet of the flesh meld. if the flesh meld dies, the swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting with the prone condition.

It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

entries.description: *Reaction:* The fomorian has a blood rune inscribed on an effigy or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Corrupting Hex action and Poisoning Rebuke reaction.The object bearing the blood rune has AC 15; 30 HP; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the fomorian dies. If the rune is destroyed, the fomorian can inscribe a blood rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

While cursed this way, the target's speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a Difficulty (16) Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted.

name: Fume Drake

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the fume drake dies, it explodes in a cloud of noxious fumes. Each creature within 5 feet of the fume drake must succeed on a Difficulty (11) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The fume drake doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 fire damage.

entries.name: Scalding Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (11). Targets who fail take 1d8 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The fungal servant has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Passive:* A destroyed fungal servant gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the fungal servant's heart.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The fungal servant is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17), +9 to hit with spell attacks). The fungal servant has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague6th level (1 slot): harm

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The fungal servant targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the fungal servant, it must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Wisdom Reaction Roll against this magic or become frightened until the end of the fungal servant's next turn. If the target fails the Reaction Roll by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the Reaction Roll is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all fungal servants for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the fungal servant makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its dreadful glare.

entries.name: Blinding Spores
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Blinding spores swirls magically around the fungal servant. Each creature within 5 feet of the fungal servant must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The fungal servant utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the fungal servant that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll or be stunned until the end of the fungal servant's next turn.

entries.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The fungal servant magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the fungal servant, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain HP until the end of the fungal servant's next turn.

entries.name: Whirlwind of Spores (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The fungal servant magically transforms into a whirlwind of spores, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the fungal servant is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the fungal servant remain in its possession.

entries.name: Chilling Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the fury must succeed on a Difficulty (20) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 11 (2d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The fury has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (cold).

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the fury can move up to its speed toward an enemy it can see.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Mind-Probing Antennae
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The gaj targets one creature grappled by it. The target must make a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage, and the gaj magically pulls one piece of information from the target's mind that the gaj wants to know. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target takes half as much damage, and the gaj learns nothing.

entries.name: Paralyze (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The gaj magically targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Galazeth Prismari

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Galazeth fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Dancing Elements Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (22). Targets who fail take 7d10 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Galazeth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (23)):1/day each: control water, gust of wind, wall of stone

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to galazeth makes one claw attack.

entries.name: Lightning Flash (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to galazeth moves up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks. when he passes within 15 feet of a creature during this move, that creature must succeed on a difficulty (22) dexterity reaction roll or take 11 (2d10) lightning damage. a creature can take this damage no more than once during the move.

entries.name: Flowing Creation (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to summon 1 elemental, who appear at Far range.

motives_tactics: Burn enemies, Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush

entries.name: Avalanche Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+5 damage.

entries.name: Animate Boulders (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The galeb duhr magically animates one or two boulders it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each boulder uses the Galeb Duhr stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1 and lacks this action. The boulder takes its turn immediately after the galeb duhr on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the galeb duhr. A boulder remains animate for 1 minute or until it or the galeb duhr dies.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

name: Gallows Speaker

entries.name: Divination Senses
entries.description: *Reaction:* The gallows speaker can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The gallows speaker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends it turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The gallows speaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Foretelling Touch
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d10+4 psychic damage.

entries.name: Suffering Echoes
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the gallows speaker targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target must make a difficulty (15) wisdom reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage, and waves of painful memories leap from the target to up to three other creatures of the gallows speaker's choice that are within 30 feet of the target, each of which takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened, Destroy life

entries.name: Fiery End
entries.description: *Passive:* If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The magen has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Static Discharge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 4d10 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Galvanic Overcast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the blastseeker casts lightning bolt or thunderwave, it can roll a die. On an odd number, the blastseeker takes 9 (2d8) force damage. On an even number, the spell also deals 9 (2d8) lightning damage to each target that fails its Reaction Roll.

entries.name: Gust-Propelled Leap
entries.description: *Passive:* The blastseeker can use a bonus action to fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Heart of the Storm
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the blastseeker casts lightning bolt or thunderwave, all other creatures within 10 feet of the blastseeker each take 3 lightning damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:3/day each: levitate, lightning bolt, thunderwave1/day: stoneskin

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6 damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the galvanice weird dies, it explodes in a burst of ice and lightning. Each creature within 10 feet of the exploding weird must make a Difficulty (13) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 7 (2d6) lightning damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+2 lightning damage.

entries.name: Weird Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* At the start of each of the gargantua's turns, each creature of the gargantua's choice within 30 feet of it must make a Difficulty (19) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, a target sees the gargantua as a manifestation of the target's worst fears; it takes 17 (5d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the start of the target's next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, a target is immune to this gargantua's Weird Aura for 24 hours.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Baleful Hex
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gargantua curses one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. the target must succeed on a difficulty (19) wisdom reaction roll or have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gargantua teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space that it can see within 120 feet of itself.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: *Reaction:* The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution Reaction Roll against the caster's spell Reaction Roll DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Damage Transfer
entries.description: *Passive:* While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

entries.name: Smother
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+3 damage and becomes *Restrained*.

name: Gargoyle

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: *Reaction:* The gargoyle doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

name: Gas Spore Fungus

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: *Reaction:* The gas spore bursts when it dies. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (10), each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the gas spore. Failure: The target takes 10 (3d6) Poison damage and has the Poisoned condition for 1d12 hours. Unless the Poisoned condition is removed, the target dies at the end of that time and sprouts 2d4 Tiny Gas Spore Fungi (each with 1 Hit Point). After 2d6 days, they become Large and have 13 HP.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d6 poison damage and becomes *Poisoned*.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 13 (3d8) force damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Stunning Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature that can see the gauth's central eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll if the gauth isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the Reaction Roll is stunned until the start of its next turn.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the Reaction Roll. If the creature does so, it can't see the gauth until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8 damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The gauth shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (roll three d6s, and reroll duplicates), targeting one to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it:1: Devour Magic Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll or have one of its magic items lose all magical properties until the start of the gauth's next turn. If the object is a charged item, it also loses 1d4 charges. Determine the affected item randomly, ignoring single-use items such as potions and scrolls.2: Enervation Ray. The target must make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.3: Fire Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.4: Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5: Pushing Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.6: Sleep Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Gazer

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (roll two d4s, and reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:1: Dazing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has penalty on attack rolls.2: Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.3: Frost Ray. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.4: Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Strength Reaction Roll or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is a Tiny object that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gazer moves up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The gearkeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Rapid Shifting
entries.description: *Passive:* Opportunity attacks made against the gearkeeper have penalty.

entries.name: Whirling Blades
entries.description: *Passive:* Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the gearkeeper takes 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Shrapnel Blast (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 6d6 damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Ooze Cube
entries.description: *Reaction:* The cube fills its entire space and is transparent. Other creatures can enter that space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has penalty on the Reaction Roll.Creatures inside the cube have Total Cover, and the cube can hold one Large creature or up to four Medium or Small creatures inside itself at a time.As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the cube can pull a creature or an object out of the cube by succeeding on a Difficulty (12) Strength (Athletics) check, and the puller takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage.

entries.name: Transparent
entries.description: *Reaction:* Even when the cube is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the cube if the creature hasn't witnessed the cube move or otherwise act.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 3d6+2 acid damage.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to spells with a Verbal component, has the Restrained condition, and takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. The cube moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. The cube can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures if it has room inside itself to contain them (see the Ooze Cube trait). Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (12), each creature whose space the cube enters for the first time during this move. Failure: 10 (3d6) Acid damage, and the target is engulfed. An engulfed target is suffocating, can't cast spells with a Verbal component, has the Restrained condition, and takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed target can try to escape by taking an action to make a Difficulty (12) Strength (Athletics) check. On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space. Success: Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cube. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the Reaction Roll instead.

name: Gem Stalker

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The gem stalker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The gem stalker doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Crystal Dart
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d10+2 magic damage.

entries.name: Amethyst
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gem stalker can teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Crystal
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gem stalker gains a number of temporary hp equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Emerald
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the next attack roll it makes before the start of the gem stalker's next turn.

entries.name: Sapphire
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the target must succeed on a difficulty (13) strength reaction roll or be pushed horizontally up to 10 feet away from the gem stalker and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Topaz
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the target must succeed on a difficulty (13) constitution reaction roll or be poisoned until the start of the gem stalker's next turn.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Regeneration

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to geryon makes one stinger attack.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the troubleshooter takes the disengage or hide action.

name: Ghost

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries.description: *Reaction:* The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Etherealness
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The ghost casts the Etherealness spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The ghost is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 3d10+3 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Horrific Visage
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 2d6+3 psychic damage and have the Frightened condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Charisma Reaction Roll: Difficulty (13), one Humanoid the ghost can see within 5 feet. Failure: The target is possessed by the ghost; the ghost disappears, and the target has the Incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The ghost's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 HP or the ghost leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours. Success: The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

entries.name: Gibbering
entries.description: *Reaction:* The mouther babbles incoherently while it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (10), any creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther while it is babbling. Failure: The target rolls 1d8 to determine what it does during the current turn:1-4. The target does nothing.5-6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.7-8. The target makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

entries.name: Incessant Gibberish

entries.name: Scale Dust (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The gigant releases magical dust from its wings in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a Difficulty (19) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, the creature has the poisoned condition for 1 hour. While poisoned this way, the creature can't regain HP.

entries.name: Drone
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gigant produces a horrid droning sound by rapidly beating its wings. each creature within 10 feet of the gigant must succeed on a difficulty (19) constitution reaction roll or take 10 (3d6) thunder damage and have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. the gigant can then fly up to half its flying speed.

name: Gingwatzim

entries.name: Alternate Forms
entries.description: *Reaction:* The gingwatzim has two alternate forms, both of which are chosen by its creator when the gingwatzim comes into being. One form is an exact duplicate of a Tiny non-magical object (such as a book, dagger, or gemstone) that its creator is carrying or wearing when the gingwatzim is conjured. The other form can be any Tiny beast. Once these alternate forms are chosen, they can't be changed.

entries.name: Energy Drain (True Form Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d6+2 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the gingwatzim changes from its true form—a 3-foot-diameter sphere of luminous ectoplasm—into one of its two alternate forms, or from one of those forms back into its true form. in object form, it can't move or make attacks but otherwise retains its statistics, and it is indistinguishable from the thing it is imitating. in beast form, it retains its hp but otherwise uses the stat block of the beast it is imitating. when it dies, the gingwatzim reverts to its true form and then vanishes.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: *Passive:* If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph into a Large hyena or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.While in hyena form, the vampire can't speak, and its walking speed is 50 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. it is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has a bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all non-magical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Rampage
entries.description: *Reaction:* When it reduces a creature to 0 HP with a melee attack on its turn, the vampire can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire doesn't require air.

entries.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries.description: *Reaction:* The vampire has the following flaws:Enraged by Celestial. If it hears words of Celestial spoken, the vampire must try to attack the source of those spoken words on its next turn. If these words come from multiple sources and from opposite directions, the vampire is restrained. Otherwise, it moves to attack what it perceives to be the closest source.Repulsed by Perfume. The vampire has penalty on melee attack rolls made against any creature wearing perfume or carrying an open container of it.Stake to the Heart. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Frightful Cackle (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the vampire emits a bone-chilling cackle. each creature of the vampire's choice that is within 120 feet of the vampire and can hear its cackle must succeed on a difficulty (15) wisdom reaction roll or become frightened for 1 minute. a creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a creature's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's frightful cackle for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Sickening Gaze (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Constitution Reaction Roll against this magic or be poisoned for 24 hours. A creature whose Reaction Roll is successful is immune to this vampire's Sickening Gaze for 24 hours.

Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. One Humanoid Gremorly can see within 5 feet of himself must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Charisma Reaction Roll or be possessed by him; Gremorly disappears, and the target has the incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. Gremorly can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn Undead, and he retains his alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions. He otherwise uses the target's game statistics, but Gremorly doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the target drops to 0 HP, Gremorly ends it as a bonus action, or Gremorly is turned or forced out by an effect like the Dispel Evil and Good spell. When the possession ends, Gremorly reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the Reaction Roll or after the possession ends.

entries.description: *Reaction:* The portrait is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the portrait must succeed on a Constitution Reaction Roll against the caster's spell Reaction Roll DC or become unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries.description: *Reaction:* An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 HP. An animated object reduced to 0 HP becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the figure in the portrait remains motionless, the portrait is indistinguishable from a normal painting.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting

After 24 hours, the seeds become creatures under the blight's control. Roll 1d8 for each seed to determine the creature it becomes: on 1-4, Twig Blight; on 5-6, Needle Blight; on 7-8, Vine Blight.
