entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The hag can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
entries.description: *Reaction:* While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:1st level (4 slots): charm person, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): alter self, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow4th level (3 slots): blight, polymorph5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming6th level (1 slot): Otto's irresistible danceFor casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell Reaction Roll DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+4 damage.

entries.name: Illusory Appearance
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a Difficulty (20) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

entries.name: Invisible Passage
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

entries.name: Shared Sorrow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the haint targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself that is missing any hp, sharing its own torment with this pained soul. the target must succeed on a difficulty (14) wisdom reaction roll or be incapacitated.a creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a creature's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the haint's shared sorrow for the next 24 hours.

name: Harmonium Captain

entries.name: Aura of Command
entries.description: *Passive:* Allies within 30 feet of the captain are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions. This aura is suppressed while the captain has the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Dictate (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The captain verbally commands up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. This magical command must be to undertake an action or to refrain from taking actions (for example, "Throw down your weapons").A target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or have the charmed condition for 1 minute, during which time it follows the captain's command. The effect ends early if the target takes damage or if it successfully completes the command. A target automatically succeeds on its Reaction Roll if the command is directly harmful to itself, such as commanding it to walk into fire.A creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful Reaction Roll.

name: Harpy Matriarch

entries.name: Luring Maestro
entries.description: *Passive:* While within 60 feet of the matriarch, creatures have penalty on saving throws against the matriarch's Luring Song.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The matriarch has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Fleeting Form
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The matriarch can magically disguise itself to resemble a humanoid of roughly similar size and shape for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. This illusion does not hold up to close scrutiny.

entries.name: Luring Song
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The matriarch sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the matriarch that can hear the song must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be charmed until the song ends. The matriarch must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the matriarch is incapacitated.While charmed by the matriarch, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the matriarch, the target must move on its turn toward the matriarch by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the matriarch, the target can repeat the Reaction Roll. A charmed target can also repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns. If the Reaction Roll is successful, the effect ends on it.A target that successfully saves is immune to this matriarch's song for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Visage of Desire (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the matriarch projects a vision into the minds of creatures within 30 feet of it that aren't constructs or undead, showing each creature achieving whatever it most desires. an affected creature must succeed on a difficulty (14) wisdom reaction roll or drop whatever it is holding and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.description: *Passive:* The hound knows the distance to and direction of any creature that has come within 30 feet of it, even if that creature is on a different plane of existence. If the creature being tracked by the hound dies, the hound knows.

entries.description: *Passive:* Attack rolls against the devil have penalty. If the devil makes an attack roll, this trait is suppressed until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its HP somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance

entries.description: *Reaction:* The quori's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (16)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: charm person3/day each: detect thoughts, disguise self, suggestion1/day: dominate person, dream

entries.name: Multiattack

entries.name: Mind Thrust
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the quori targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. the target must make a difficulty (16) wisdom reaction roll, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Charisma Reaction Roll or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 HP, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the Reaction Roll or after the possession ends.

entries.name: Aura of Invulnerability
entries.description: *Passive:* An invisible aura forms a 10-foot-radius sphere around the hollyphant for as long as it lives. Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells. The hollyphant can use an action to suppress this trait until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting

entries.description: *Passive:* The devil has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (fire).

entries.name: Infernal Tail
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Dexterity Reaction Roll: Difficulty (17), one creature the devil can see within 10 feet. Failure: 10 (1d8 + 6) Necrotic damage, and the target receives an infernal wound if it doesn't have one. While wounded, the target loses 10 (3d6) HP at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores HP to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom (Medicine) check.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the horrid plant is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the horrid plant move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Nature) check to discern that the horrid plant isn't an ordinary plant.

entries.name: Horrid Plant Varieties
entries.description: *Passive:* A horrid plant comes in one of three varieties (choose or roll a d6): 1-2, dew drinker; 3-4, purple blossom; or 5-6, snapper saw. This form determines certain traits in this stat block.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Sap Squirt (Purple Blossom Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the horrid plant targets one creature it can see within 15 feet of itself. the target must succeed on a difficulty (14) dexterity reaction roll or take 28 (8d6) acid damage and become covered in acidic sap. this sap lasts for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to scrape the sap off itself or another creature it can reach. a creature covered in sap takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Spiked Leaves (Snapper Saw Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to creatures within 10 feet of the horrid plant and not behind total cover must make a difficulty (14) dexterity reaction roll, taking 21 (6d6) slashing damage on a failed reaction roll or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Vampiric Tendril (Dew Drinker Only)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one creature grappled by the horrid plant must make a difficulty (13) constitution reaction roll, taking 10 (3d6) necrotic damage on a failed reaction roll or half as much damage on a successful one. the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the horrid plant regains hp equal to that amount. this reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. the target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Aura of Menace
entries.description: *Reaction:* As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: detect evil and good1/day each: aid, continual flame

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The archon magically transforms into any Medium or Large dog or wolf while retaining its game statistics (other than its size and losing its Shining Blade attack). The archon reverts to its true form if reduced to 0 HP or if it uses a bonus action to do so.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries.description: *Passive:* The hound appears with a number of temporary HP equal to half your sorcerer level.

entries.name: Ever at Your Heels
entries.description: *Action:* On its turn, it can move only toward its target by the most direct route, and it can use its action only to attack its target. The hound can make opportunity attacks, but only against its target. Additionally, while the hound is within 5 feet of the target, the target has penalty on saving throws against any spell you cast. The hound disappears if it is reduced to 0 HP, if its target is reduced to 0 HP, or after 5 minutes.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: *Passive:* The hound has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Omen Sight
entries.description: *Passive:* At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The hound has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+3 damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* A howler has a bonus on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the howler's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (psychic).

entries.name: Mind-Breaking Howl (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 3d10 psychic damage and have the Frightened condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

name: Howling Hatred Initiate

entries.name: Guiding Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Passive:* As a bonus action, the initiate gains bonus on the next ranged attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: *Passive:* The initiate can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting

It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): blade ward, gust, light, prestidigitation, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): feather fall, shield, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): dust devil, gust of wind3rd level (2 slots): gaseous form

entries.description: *Passive:* On one of its claws, the crab wears a rune-covered copper band that makes it immune to being charmed, frightened, and paralyzed. The copper band is worthless as a treasure, as the magic is keyed to this crab.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 4d10+5 damage.

entries.description: *Passive:* Any non-magical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical metal in 1 round.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

A creature within 30 feet of it can discern its true nature with a successful Difficulty (15) Intelligence (Nature) check.

On each of its turns while berserk, the shadow attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the shadow attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the shadow goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP.

entries.description: *Passive:* A humanoid slain by a melee attack from the zombie revives as a husk zombie on its next turn.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.description: *Passive:* Hutijin regains 20 HP at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Hutijin dies only if he starts his turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d10+8 lightning damage.

entries.name: Teleport

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: *Passive:* During its first turn, the hybrid poisoner has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the hybrid scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* The hydra has five heads. Whenever the hydra takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The hydra dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the hydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 20 HP when it grows new heads.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra Reaction that can be used only for Opportunity Attacks.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The hydroloth has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Secure Memory
entries.description: *Passive:* The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx, as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

entries.name: Watery Advantage
entries.description: *Passive:* While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has a bonus on attack rolls.

entries.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a Difficulty (16) Intelligence Reaction Roll. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target loses all proficiencies; it can't cast spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the hydroloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the magen's eyes glow silver as it targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (12) wisdom reaction roll or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Suggestion
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The magen casts the suggestion spell (Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)), requiring no material components. The target must be a creature that the magen can communicate with telepathically. If it succeeds on its Reaction Roll, the target is immune to this magen's suggestion spell for the next 24 hours. The magen's spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

name: Hythonia

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Hythonia's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18)). She can innately cast animate objects once per day requiring no material components.1/day: animate objects

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Hythonia fails a Reaction Roll, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature that can see Hythonia's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of her, Hythonia can force it to make a Difficulty (18) Constitution Reaction Roll if she isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the Reaction Roll fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, on a failed Reaction Roll the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Hythonia until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Hythonia in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll. If Hythonia sees herself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of her and in an area of bright light, she is affected by her own gaze.

entries.name: Shed Skin (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Passive:* If Hythonia is reduced to 0 HP, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she sheds her skin, regains 199 HP, and moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Move
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to hythonia moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Snaky Hair
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to hythonia makes one attack with her snaky hair.

entries.name: Petrified Earth (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to hythonia causes stone spikes to erupt from the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on her. the area becomes difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. any creature, other than hythonia, takes 9 (2d8) piercing damage for every 5 feet it moves on those spikes.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its HP somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The devil has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (cold).

entries.name: Ice Wall (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The devil casts Wall of Ice (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17)).

At the start of the troll's turn, all non-magical flames in the aura are extinguished. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the troll takes 10 (3d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The ice troll regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The ice troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The illithilich's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (20)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.At will: detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the illithilich fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The illithilich has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Passive:* If it has a phylactery, a destroyed illithilich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The illithilich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (20), +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, Melf's acid arrow, mirror image3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun9th level (1 slot): power word kill

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The illithilich has a bonus on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The elder brain is aware of creatures within 1 mile of itself that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: *Passive:* The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Psychic Link
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the elder brain targets one creature with the incapacitated condition that the elder brain senses with its creature sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. until the link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. the target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it no longer has the incapacitated condition, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). the target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful difficulty (17) charisma check. if the target breaks the link this way, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. the link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 1 mile apart. the elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

entries.name: Devour Intellect
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to intelligence reaction roll: difficulty (12), one creature the intellect devourer can see within 5 feet. failure: 11 (2d10) psychic damage, and the target has the stunned condition until the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

entries.name: Steal Body
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Intelligence Reaction Roll: Difficulty (12), one Small or Medium creature within 5 feet that has the Incapacitated condition, is a Humanoid or Beast, and has 10 HP or fewer. Failure: The intellect devourer possesses the target, consumes its brain, and teleports inside its skull. While there, the intellect devourer has Total Cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The intellect devourer retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; its understanding of Deep Speech; its telepathy; and its Detect Intelligence trait. It otherwise adopts the target's game statistics. It knows everything the target knew, including spells and languages.If the host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. The intellect devourer is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a Wish spell. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the intellect devourer can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies unless its brain is restored before the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Cacophony of Minds
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the intellect snare must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll or have the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. An incapacitated creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the Reaction Roll is immune to this intellect snare's Cacophony of Minds for 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The intellect snare has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Siphon Thoughts
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the intellect snare targets one creature it is grappling. the target must make a difficulty (17) intelligence reaction roll, taking 21 (6d6) psychic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. the intellect snare then regains a number of hp equal to the amount of damage taken.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any non-magical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The pudding's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: dancing lights, mage hand3/day each: darkness, faerie fire, shield1/day: Melf's acid arrow

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 acid damage.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Invisible Stalker

Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (14), one Large or smaller creature in the stalker's space. Failure: 7 (1d8 + 3) Thunder damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Until the grapple ends, the target can't cast spells with a Verbal component and takes 7 (2d6) Thunder damage at the start of each of the stalker's turns.

entries.name: Immutable Form

entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale poison in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 10d10 poison damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Acidic Blood
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of the hydra takes 9 (2d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: *Passive:* The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: *Passive:* The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has a bonus on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever the hydra takes 35 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 HP for each head regrown in this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: *Passive:* While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries.description: *Passive:* The AC of Isolde includes her Charisma bonus.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Isolde's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)). Isolde can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: alter self, command, detect magic1/day: plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Magic Resistance Aura
entries.description: *Passive:* While holding Nepenthe, Isolde creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around her. While this aura is active, Isolde and all creatures friendly to her in the aura have bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

If the target suffers any harm from Isolde or another creature or receives a suicidal command from Isolde, the target can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's Reaction Roll is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Isolde's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Isperia's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (23)). Isperia can innately cast imprisonment twice per day, requiring no material components.

entries.description: *Action:* Isperia is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, as well as any divination spell that she refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain her intentions or sincerity have penalty.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Isperia fails a Reaction Roll, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Isperia has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Isperia has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, resistance, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, ensnaring strike, sanctuary, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): arcane lock, augury, calm emotions, hold person, silence, zone of truth3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance, counterspell, dispel magic, tongues4th level (3 slots): divination, locate creature5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, scrying6th level (1 slot): word of recall7th level (1 slot): divine word8th level (1 slot): antimagic field

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

name: Jabberwock

entries.name: Confusing Burble
entries.description: *Reaction:* The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a Difficulty (18) Charisma Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:1-2. The creature does nothing.3. The creature does nothing except use all its movement to move in a random direction.4. The creature either makes one melee attack against a random creature it can see or does nothing if no visible creature is within its reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the jabberwock fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The jabberwock regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Uncanny Tracker
entries.description: *Passive:* The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the jackalwere shape-shifts into a medium human or a medium jackal-humanoid hybrid, or it returns to its true form (that of a small jackal). other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The spider is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the leech is reduced to 0 HP while attached to a ship that has a spelljamming helm, the creature attuned to that helm must make a Difficulty (13) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 10 (4d4) psychic damage and is incapacitated for 1 minute. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature takes half as much damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the leech attaches itself to a ship's hull in its space, dealing 2 (1d4) piercing damage to the ship (ignoring the ship's damage threshold). this damage can't be repaired until the leech is scraped off the hull. while the leech is attached, its speed is 0, and it can detach itself as a bonus action. as an action, a creature within reach of the leech can to try to scrape it off the hull, doing so with a successful difficulty (18) strength check. on a failed check, the action is wasted as the leech remains attached to the hull. removing the leech in this way deals no damage to the leech or the ship.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Jarad fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Jarad has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Jarad is a 14th-level Golgari spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (20), +12 to hit with spell attacks). Jarad has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): entangle, ray of sickness, sleep2nd level (3 slots): Melf's acid arrow, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb, web3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, plant growth, vampiric touch4th level (3 slots): blight, giant insect, grasping vine5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, insect plague6th level (1 slot): circle of death, create undead7th level (1 slot): finger of death, forcecage

entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces Jarad to 0 HP, he must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, he drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.description: *Reaction:* The jiangshi has the following flaws:Fear of Its Own Reflection. If the jiangshi sees its own reflection, it immediately uses its reaction, if available, to move as far away from the reflection as possible.Susceptible to Holy Symbols. While the jiangshi is wearing or touching a holy symbol, it automatically fails saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The jiangshi doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Consume Energy
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the jiangshi draws energy from a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target makes a difficulty (16) constitution reaction roll, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. the jiangshi regains hp equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. after regaining hp from this action, the jiangshi gains the following benefits for 7 days: its walking speed increases to 40 feet, and it gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed and can hover.a humanoid slain by this necrotic damage rises as a wight (see its entry in the monster manual) at the end of the jiangshi's turn. the wight acts immediately after the jiangshi in the initiative order. if this wight slays a humanoid with its life drain, the wight transforms into a jiangshi 5 days later.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the jiangshi polymorphs into a beast, a humanoid, or an undead that is medium or small or back into its true form. its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the jiangshi's choice). it reverts to its true form if it dies.

name: Juvenile Hook Horror

entries.name: Echolocation
entries.description: *Passive:* The hook horror can't use its blindsight while deafened.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: *Passive:* The hook horror has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The kraken can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Freedom of Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from non-magical restraints or being grappled.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (acid).

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 40 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. if a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. if the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a difficulty (13) dexterity reaction roll or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The kraken magically create a bolt of lightning, which can strike a target the kraken can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a Difficulty (18) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Tentacle Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the kraken makes one tentacle attack.

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the kraken uses fling.

entries.name: Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 2d10 poison damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The mimic can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4 acid damage.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the mimic polymorphs into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. its statistics are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. it reverts to its true form if it dies.

name: Juvenile Shadow Dragon

entries.name: Living Shadow
entries.description: *Action:* While in Dim Light or Darkness, the dragon has Resistance to damage that isn't Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: *Passive:* While in sunlight, the dragon has penalty on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Shadow Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 5d6 necrotic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to while in dim light or darkness, the dragon takes the hide action.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Ambush, Strike from shadows

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The kakkuu has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The kakkuu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: *Reaction:* When in contact with a web, the kakkuu knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: *Passive:* The kakkuu ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Far range. Targets this adversary succeeds against take the standard attack damage.

entries.name: Web Snare
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes the standard attack poison damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: All-Around Vision
entries.description: *Passive:* The quori can't be surprised while it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The quori can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The quori's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (21), +13 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: arcane eye3/day each: clairvoyance, confusion, dream, eyebite

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The quori has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Mind Seed (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The quori touches one humanoid, which must succeed on a Difficulty (21) Intelligence Reaction Roll or be cursed. The curse lasts until it's removed by a remove curse or greater restoration spell.The cursed target suffers 1 level of exhaustion every 24 hours, and finishing a long rest doesn't reduce its exhaustion. If the cursed target reaches exhaustion level 6, it doesn't die; it instead becomes a thrall under the quori's control, and all its exhaustion is removed. Only the wish spell can free the thrall from this control.

entries.name: Swarm of Eyes (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range emanation. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (21). Targets who fail take 10d8 psychic damage and have the Blinded condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Difficulty (21) Charisma Reaction Roll or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 HP, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the Reaction Roll or after the possession ends.

entries.name: Dual Mind
entries.description: *Passive:* The kalashtar has a bonus on Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Mind Thrust
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the kalashtar targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (12) wisdom reaction roll or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: *Passive:* The kamadan has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the kamadan moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn that target must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone. If the target is knocked prone, the kamadan can make two attacks—one with its bite and one with its snakes—against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Sleep Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (12). Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian is reduced to 0 HP, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The soldier has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the soldier's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the soldier to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the soldier drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Customizable Storage
entries.description: *Action:* A keg robot can hold up to three types of liquid payload totaling 12 gallons within its hollow, barrel-shaped body. A full keg robot can make one liquid attack per gallon before the liquid must be refilled. Filling a keg robot takes 2 rounds per gallon. Differing payloads can alter the keg robot's attacks from those presented here.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 damage.

entries.name: Acid Squirt
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 acid damage.

entries.name: Beer Shower
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range cone. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage (fire).

entries.name: Hot Oil Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range cone. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 1d8+3 fire damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The kelpie can breathe air and water.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the kelpie remains motionless in its true form, it is indistinguishable from normal seaweed.

entries.name: Seaweed Shape
entries.description: *Passive:* The kelpie can use its action to reshape its body into the form of a humanoid or beast that is Small, Medium, or Large. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged. The disguise is convincing, unless the kelpie is in bright light or the viewer is within 30 feet of it, in which case the seams between the seaweed strands are visible. The kelpie returns to its true form if takes a bonus action to do so or if it dies.

entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the kelubar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (2d4) acid damage.

entries.name: Boundless Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The kelubar ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The kelubar has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spit Acid
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (17). Targets who fail take 6d8 acid damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to summon 1 ally, who appear at Far range.

entries.name: Nauseating Fog (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The kelubar magically creates a cloud of greenish fog that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of itself. The cloud remains for 1 minute or until the kelubar uses this bonus action again. The cloud is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the cloud or enters the cloud for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Constitution Reaction Roll or have the poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Elusive
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the kender takes the disengage or hide action.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The kenku can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Shadow Blade
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Eldritch Lantern (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The kenku casts Faerie Fire, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (10)).

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the knight's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its HP. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

entries.name: Messy End
entries.description: *Reaction:* The kobold explodes 3 rounds after it dies, or immediately if it was killed by a critical hit. The explosion destroys the kobold's body, leaving its equipment behind. Each creature within 5 feet of the exploding kobold must make a Difficulty (10) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The kobold has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: *Passive:* While in sunlight, the kobold has penalty on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Steal, Flee when outnumbered, Attack in groups

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vampire's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The vampire doesn't require air.

entries.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries.description: *Reaction:* The vampire has the following flaws:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it starts its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is incapacitated in its resting place.Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+4 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the prawn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (11) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: *Passive:* The prawn can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+1 damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The kolyarut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the kolyarut fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The kolyarut has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Relentless (3)

entries.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The kolyarut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The kolyarut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Charisma Reaction Roll or be sent to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: *Passive:* The korred has a bonus on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting

The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (13)):At will: commune with nature (as an action), meld into stone, stone shape1/day: Otto's irresistible dance

entries.name: Command Hair
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. the korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a large or smaller creature that the korred can see. the target must succeed on a difficulty (13) dexterity reaction roll or become grappled by the rope (escape difficulty (13)). until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. the korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated.a rope of korred hair has ac 20 and 20 hp. it regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korred's turns while the rope has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. if the rope drops to 0 hp, it is destroyed.

entries.name: Relentless (3)

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the kraken throws a large or smaller creature grappled by it to a space it can see within 60 feet of itself that isn't in the air. dexterity reaction roll: difficulty (25), the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space. failure: 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage, and the target has the prone condition. success: half damage only.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to dexterity reaction roll: difficulty (23), one creature the kraken can see within 120 feet. failure: 33 (6d10) lightning damage. success: half damage.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to dexterity reaction roll: difficulty (25), one creature grappled by the kraken (it can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time). failure: 23 (3d8 + 10) piercing damage. if the target is large or smaller, it is swallowed and no longer grappled. a swallowed creature has the restrained condition, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and takes 24 (7d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.if the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a difficulty (25) constitution reaction roll at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the kraken with the prone condition. if the kraken dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.
