entries.description: *Passive:* Unless Lazav is incapacitated, he is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with Lazav only if he allows it.

entries.name: Shapechanger Savant
entries.description: *Passive:* Lazav can use a bonus action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid he has seen. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (psychic).

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to lazav makes a weapon attack.

entries.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Lazav casts one of his innate spells.

entries.name: Shifting Nightmare (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to lazav rapidly takes the form of several nightmarish creatures, lashing out at all nearby. each creature within 10 feet of lazav must succeed on a difficulty (21) dexterity reaction roll or take 18 (4d8) damage of a type chosen by lazav: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or necrotic.

entries.name: Hellish Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the lemure dies in the Nine Hells, it revives with all its HP in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a creature under the effects of a Bless spell or its remains are sprinkled with Holy Water.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Vile Slime
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d4 poison damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the leonin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The leonin's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: banishment, detect evil and good

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: *Passive:* While the leonin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Industrious
entries.description: *Passive:* The leprechaun is proficient with all artisan's tools and adds double its proficiency bonus to ability checks made with them.

entries.name: Reluctant Refusal
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature offers the leprechaun the chance to partake in merriment or revelry such as a song, a dance, or a good meal, the leprechaun must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom Reaction Roll or have the charmed condition for 24 hours. While charmed in this way, the leprechaun partakes of the offering, treats the creature as a trusted friend, and seeks to defend it from harm. The charmed condition ends if the creature or any of its allies damage the leprechaun, force the leprechaun to make a Reaction Roll, or steal from the leprechaun.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Gift of Luck (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The leprechaun touches a creature and magically gifts the target a measure of luck. The creature gains the leprechaun's Astonishing Luck reaction. The creature can use the reaction three times, after which this gift goes away. The leprechaun can revoke this gift from a creature at any time (no action required). A creature can benefit from only one leprechaun's Gift of Luck at a time.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The leprechaun casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)):At will: Mending (as an action), Prestidigitation2/day each: Invisibility, Phantasmal Force1/day each: Fabricate (as an action), Mislead

entries.name: Cunning Trick
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the leprechaun takes the disengage or hide action or makes a dexterity (sleight of hand) check.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Lesser Death Dragon

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Cataclysmic Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a Medium range cone. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (16). Targets who fail take 8d8 necrotic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Tactician
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to spotlight this adversary and two allies within Close range.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Command allies, Coordinate attacks

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: *Passive:* The mummy wears a ring of fire resistance.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The mummy lord has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Passive:* A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Wisdom Reaction Roll against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the Reaction Roll by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the Reaction Roll is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Aberrant Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the emissary drops to 0 HP, its body melts away. A greater star spawn emissary instantly appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of where the lesser emissary disappeared. The greater emissary uses the lesser emissary's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the emissary fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The emissary doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (acid).

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the emissary polymorphs into a small or medium creature of its choice or back into its true form. its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Psychic Orb
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the emissary makes a psychic orb attack.

entries.name: Teleportation Maw (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the emissary teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and can make a lashing maw attack.

entries.name: Psychic Lash (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the emissary targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it and psychically lashes at that creature's mind. the target must succeed on a difficulty (21) wisdom reaction roll or take 36 (8d8) psychic damage and be stunned until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within 5 feet of the leucrotta must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Constitution Reaction Roll or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Kicking Retreat
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to immediately after the leucrotta makes a hooves attack, it takes the disengage action.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the leviathan fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Partial Freeze
entries.description: *Passive:* If the leviathan takes 50 cold damage or more during a single turn, the leviathan partially freezes; until the end of its next turn, its speeds are reduced to 20 feet, and it makes attack rolls with penalty.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* The leviathan deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Water Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The leviathan can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (acid).

entries.name: Tidal Wave (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The leviathan magically creates a wave of water that extends from a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The wave is up to 250 feet long, up to 250 feet tall, and up to 50 feet wide. Each creature in the wave must make a Difficulty (24) Strength Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, a creature takes 45 (7d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful Reaction Roll, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 250 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

entries.name: Move
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the leviathan moves up to its speed.

entries.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the leviathan makes one slam attack.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the lich fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Spirit Jar
entries.description: *Passive:* If destroyed, the lich reforms in 1d10 days if it has a spirit jar, reviving with all its HP. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the lich's lair.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The lich casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (20)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic, Fireball (level 5 version), Invisibility, Lightning Bolt (level 5 version), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation2/day each: Animate Dead, Dimension Door, Plane Shift1/day each: Chain Lightning, Finger of Death, Power Word Kill, Scrying

entries.name: Deathly Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Far range. Targets this adversary succeeds against take the standard attack damage.

entries.name: Disrupt Life
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (20). Targets who fail take 9d6 necrotic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Frightening Gaze
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The lich casts Fear, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. The lich can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the lich fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Passive:* If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The lich casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (Reaction Roll Difficulty (19)):At will: druidcraft3/day each: detect magic, fog cloud, pass without trace1/day each: antilife shell, dispel magic, speak with plants, transport via plants

entries.name: Wither
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d6 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fire Storm (7th-Level Spell; 1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The lich fills up to ten 10-foot cubes with fire. Every cube must be within 150 feet of the lich and occupy a space the lich can see, and each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Difficulty (19) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 38 (7d10) fire damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If the lich chooses, plant life in the area is unaffected by the spell.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the lich makes an attack.

entries.name: Poison Prick (Cost 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the lich targets one poisoned creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (19) constitution reaction roll or fall unconscious until the poisoned condition ends on it.

entries.name: Sap Life (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (19) constitution reaction roll or take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. the lich regains a number of hp equal to the amount of damage that the creature takes.

entries.name: Light Absorption
entries.description: *Action:* If the light devourer spends any part of its turn in an area of bright light or is subjected to radiant damage, it radiates dim light in a 10-foot radius for 1 hour.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: *Passive:* The light devourer can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

entries.name: Radiant Discharge
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 7d6 radiant damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP.The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 HP or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The lightning hulk sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entries.name: Lightning Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The lightning hulk can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the lightning hulk enters a creature's space on a turn, or if it begins its turn in a creature's space, that creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. The hulk can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. A creature that touches the lightning hulk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Arc Lightning
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d8 lightning damage.

name: Lion

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: *Passive:* The lion has a bonus on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: *Passive:* With a 10-foot running start, the lion can Long Jump up to 25 feet.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Roar
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to wisdom reaction roll: difficulty (11), one creature within 15 feet. failure: the target has the frightened condition until the start of the lion's next turn.

motives_tactics: Hunt, Defend territory, Work in pack

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Blood-Chilling Roar (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the liondrake lets out a terrifying roar audible out to 300 feet. any creature within 30 feet of the liondrake that can hear its roar must succeed on a difficulty (14) wisdom reaction roll or be frightened of the liondrake for 1 minute. a creature that fails the reaction roll by 5 or more is also paralyzed for the same duration. a creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. if a target's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this liondrake's blood-chilling roar for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Force Fist
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d8+8 magic damage.

entries.name: Grasping Hand
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The living spell attempts to grab a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Dexterity Reaction Roll or be grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The living spell can grapple only one creature at a time and can't use Force Fist until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unfettered
entries.description: *Action:* The living spell can move through any barrier, even a wall of magical force.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Force Blade
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d12 magic damage.

name: Living Burning Hands

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magical Strike
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 fire damage.

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 3d6 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

name: Living Cloudkill

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The living spell creates a 40-foot-diameter sphere of fog within 60 feet of it (the fog spreads around corners). When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.The fog moves 10 feet away from the living spell at the start of each of its turns, rolling along the ground and through openings. The fog lasts for 10 minutes or until the living spell's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

name: Living Demiplane

entries.name: Dimensional Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell can enter another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The living spell can't detach from a solid surface, such as a wall, ceiling, or floor. If it has no surface to attach to, the living spell is destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

entries.name: Extradimensional Chamber
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the living spell enters another creature's space (or vice versa) for the first time on a turn, the other creature must succeed on a Difficulty (10) Dexterity Reaction Roll or be pulled into the living spell's extradimensional space, an unfurnished stone chamber 30 feet in every dimension. A creature too big to fit in this space succeeds on the Reaction Roll automatically. Creatures in the chamber never run out of breathable air. Magic that enables transit between planes, such as plane shift, can be used to escape the chamber, which has no exits otherwise. Creatures trapped inside the extradimensional chamber can't see, target, or deal damage to the living spell; however, they can damage the room around them. Each 5-foot-square section of ceiling, wall, and floor in the chamber has AC 17, 50 HP, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that is non-magical. If any section is reduced to 0 HP, the living spell and its chamber are destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Planar Destruction
entries.description: *Reaction:* The living spell is destroyed when it or a 5-foot-square section of its extradimensional chamber is reduced to 0 HP, or when the living spell has no surface to attach to. When the living spell is destroyed, the contents of its extradimensional chamber are expelled, appearing as close to the living spell's previous location as possible. Each expelled creature appears in a randomly determined unoccupied space, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the doll is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the doll move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the doll is animate.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The doll regains 5 HP at the start of its turn. If the doll takes fire or psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doll's next turn. The doll is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The doll doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Grabby Hands
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d10 psychic damage.

entries.name: Cackle (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the doll cackles as it targets one or two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. each target that can hear the doll's cackling must make a difficulty (11) wisdom reaction roll, succeeding automatically if it has an intelligence of 4 or lower. on a failed reaction roll, the creature takes 5 (2d4) psychic damage and is incapacitated for 1 minute as it is overcome by a fit of laughter. at the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success. a creature that succeeds on this reaction roll is immune to this doll's cackle for 24 hours.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Whirl (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the statue can use its action to spin at the waist, targeting creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it. each target must make a difficulty (13) dexterity reaction roll, taking 19 (3d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

name: Living Lightning Bolt

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The living spell has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (lightning).

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 8d6 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Brilliance (True Form Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* The living portent sheds bright light for 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

entries.name: Multiattack

entries.name: Attractive Pollen (1/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the mantrap detects any creatures nearby, it can use its reaction to release pollen out to a radius of 30 feet. Any beast or humanoid within the area must succeed on a Difficulty (11) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be forced to use all its movement on its turns to get as close to the the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* While the mantrap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary tropical plant.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 4d6 acid damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The marid can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: *Passive:* If the marid dies outside the Elemental Plane of Water, its body dissolves into brine, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its HP somewhere on the Plane of Water.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: *Passive:* The marid has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the marid knows it, the marid can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the marid can understand. If the marid casts the spell for the creature, the marid suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the marid has cast it three times, the marid can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (cold).

entries.description: *Passive:* The marilith has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Teleport (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the marilith teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (20) Charisma Reaction Roll or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the Reaction Roll fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the Reaction Roll begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll.If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

name: Memory Web

entries.name: Damage Transfer
entries.description: *Passive:* While it is grappling a creature, the memory web takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the web takes the other half.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the memory web is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the memory web move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the memory web is animate.

entries.name: Memory Flood
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the memory web is reduced to 0 HP, it discharges any memories it consumed over the past 24 hours in a telepathic deluge. Hazy, dreamlike visions of these discharged memories lodge in the minds of creatures up to 120 feet from the memory web.

entries.name: Ensnare
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d8+3 damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Drain Memories
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The memory web targets one creature grappled by it. The target must make a Difficulty (12) Intelligence Reaction Roll. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the Reaction Roll automatically. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target takes 5 (2d4) psychic damage and becomes memory drained until it finishes a long rest or the memory web is destroyed.While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 each time it makes an ability check or attack roll, subtracting the d4 roll from it. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target has the unconscious condition for 1 hour. If a memory drained creature is the target of the Greater Restoration or Heal spell, the memory drained effect ends on it. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target takes half as much damage only.

The mongrelfolk has leathery wings and a flying speed of 40 feet.11–15: Keen Hearing and Smell. The mongrelfolk has a bonus on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.16–17: Spider Climb. The mongrelfolk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.18–19: Standing Leap. The mongrelfolk's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.20: Two-Headed. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains bonus on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.4–5: The giant makes one Fist attack against each creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant makes one Fist attack against itself.6–7: The giant makes one Bite attack against one random creature within reach. If no other creatures are within reach, its eyes glaze over and it is stunned until the start of its next turn.8–10: The giant makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. entries.name: Devour Soul
entries.description: *Passive:* A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a Construct nor an Undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within 5 feet of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature's number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu's HP by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.

Targets who fail take 8d6 psychic damage and have the Frightened condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Infernal Tack
entries.description: *Passive:* The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion as an action.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The narzugon has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (fire).

entries.name: Infernal Command
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Command
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to each creature within 60 feet of the narzugon that isn't a fiend must succeed on a difficulty (17) charisma reaction roll or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. a creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. a creature that makes a successful reaction roll is immune to this narzugon's terrifying command for 24 hours.

entries.name: Healing (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hp.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the necrichor fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: *Passive:* Unless its lifeless remains are splashed with holy water or placed in a vessel under the effects of the hallow spell, the destroyed necrichor re-forms in 1d10 days, regaining all its hits points and appearing in the place it died or in the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The necrichor can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The necrichor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15)):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web1/day: circle of death

entries.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to summon 1 undead minion, who appear at Far range.

entries.name: Skull Flail
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8 damage.

entries.name: Claws of the Grave
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d4+3 necrotic damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Body
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the centipede or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 6d10+7 necrotic damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d4+1 damage.

entries.name: Needles
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d4+1 damage.

entries.name: Brain Dump
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the neh-thalggu consumes a brain, it gains the magical ability to speak and understand languages known by the brain's previous owner.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The neh-thalggu doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The neh-thalggu magically emits psychic energy at one Humanoid it can see within 10 feet of itself. The target must make a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the spell, as indicated:1/day each: arms of Hadar (1 brain), detect magic (2 brains), magic missile (3 brains), Tenser's floating disk (4 brains), darkness (5 brains), hold person (6 brains), invisibility (7 brains), spider climb (8 brains), fear (9 brains), hypnotic pattern (10 brains), major image (11 brains), stinking cloud (12 brains). The neh-thalggu casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (11)). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:1/day each: arms of Hadar (1 brain), detect magic (2 brains), magic missile (3 brains), Tenser's floating disk (4 brains), darkness (5 brains), hold person (6 brains), invisibility (7 brains), spider climb (8 brains), fear (9 brains), hypnotic pattern (10 brains), major image (11 brains), stinking cloud (12 brains)

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: *Passive:* The neogi has a bonus on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Minion (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary is defeated when it takes any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional Minion within range that the attack would hit.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d4+1 poison damage and becomes *Poisoned*.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: *Passive:* The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny neogi hatchling. The swarm can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

entries.name: Swarm of Bites
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 6d6+1 poison damage and becomes *Poisoned*.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: *Passive:* Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

entries.description: *Passive:* The neogi has a bonus on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The neothelid has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (16)):At will: levitate1/day each: confusion, feeblemind, telekinesis

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 3d8+8 acid damage and becomes *Restrained*.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale acid in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 10d6 acid damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The nereid can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Aquatic Invisibility
entries.description: *Action:* If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

entries.name: Mantle Dependent
entries.description: *Passive:* The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and HP equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

entries.name: Shape Water
entries.description: *Passive:* The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of 30 feet and can affect a cube of water no larger than 30 feet on a side.

entries.name: Speak With Animals
entries.description: *Passive:* The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

entries.name: Blinding Acid
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d12+3 acid damage.

entries.name: Drowning Kiss (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range area. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 3d12+3 acid damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Water Lash
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Strength Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 4d6+3 damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

name: Nergaliid

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: *Passive:* While in dim light or darkness, the nergaliid can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: *Passive:* The nergaliid's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d8+4 poison damage and becomes *Poisoned*.

entries.name: Tongue Lash
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d12+4 damage.

entries.name: Siphon Life (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The nergaliid magically draws the life from a humanoid it can see within 40 feet of it. The target must make a Difficulty (15) Wisdom Reaction Roll. An incapacitated target fails the Reaction Roll automatically. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the nergaliid gains temporary HP equal to the damage taken. On a successful Reaction Roll, the target takes half as much damage, and the nergaliid doesn't gain temporary HP. If this damage kills the target, its body rises at the end of the nergaliid's current turn as a husk zombie (see earlier in this chapter).

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

entries.name: Aura of Murder
entries.description: *Passive:* As long as the night blade is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within 5 feet of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 damage.

entries.name: Coven Magic
entries.description: *Reaction:* While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The hag has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Bag
entries.description: *Passive:* The hag has a soul bag. While holding or carrying the bag, the hag can use its Nightmare Haunting action.The bag has AC 15, HP 20, and Resistance to all damage. The bag turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP. If the bag is destroyed, any souls the bag is holding are released. The hag can create a new bag after 7 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day; Requires Soul Bag)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag casts Dream, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. Only the hag can serve as the spell's messenger, and the target must be a creature the hag can see on the Material Plane. The spell fails and is wasted if the target is under the effect of the Protection from Evil and Good spell or within a Magic Circle spell.If the target takes damage from the Dream spell, the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to that damage. If the spell kills the target, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag, and the target can't be raised from the dead until its soul is released.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Magic, Etherealness, Magic Missile (level 4 version)2/day each: Phantasmal Killer, Plane Shift (self only)

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the hag shape-shifts into a small or medium humanoid, or it returns to its true form. other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The scavver doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d10+5 damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

name: Nightmare

entries.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The nightmare can grant Resistance to Fire damage to a rider while it is on the nightmare.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The nightmare sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d8+4 fire damage.

entries.name: Ethereal Stride
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it teleport to the ethereal plane from the material plane or vice versa.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened, Corrupt

entries.name: Aura of Nightmares
entries.description: *Reaction:* Undead creatures within 30 feet of the shepherd gain a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When any other creature that isn't undead or a construct starts its turn within 30 feet of the shepherd, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The shepherd's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The shepherd has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Herd the Underworld (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the shepherd pulls twisted souls from the underworld; 1d6 shadows (without sunlight weakness) arise in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the shepherd. the shadows act right after the shepherd on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. they disappear when the shepherd dies.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: *Passive:* Nightsea Chil-liren can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6 damage.

entries.name: Mount
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the specter isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto its gloamwing mount, provided the specter and the gloamwing are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the specter appears astride the gloamwing along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the specter can't be surprised, and both it and its mount gain bonus on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (psychic).

entries.name: Mind Twist (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 5d8 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Reap Memory (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the specter touches one incapacitated creature and chooses 1 hour from among the past 24. unless the creature succeeds on a difficulty (15) intelligence reaction roll, the creature loses all memory of that hour. the creature regains the memory only if the specter dies within the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Annihilating Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a Difficulty (21) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

entries.name: Life Eater
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature dies if reduced to 0 HP by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (21) wisdom reaction roll or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. while frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. if a target's reaction roll is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's finger of doom for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Nilbogism
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a Difficulty (12) Charisma Reaction Roll or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.The nilbog can't regain HP, including through magical healing, except through its Reversal of Fortune reaction.

entries.name: Fool's Scepter
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+2 damage.

entries.name: Mocking Word
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (12) wisdom reaction roll or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have penalty on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)):At will: mage hand, Tasha's hideous laughter

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the nilbog takes the disengage or hide action.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The nimblewright has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: *Passive:* The nimblewright's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Repairable
entries.description: *Reaction:* As long as it has at least 1 hit point remaining, the nimblewright regains 1 hit point when a mending spell is cast on it.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: *Passive:* The nimblewright has a bonus on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d8+3 damage.

entries.name: Nimble Movement
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the nimblewright takes the disengage action.

name: Niv-Mizzet

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Niv-Mizzet fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Locus of the Firemind
entries.description: *Passive:* Niv-Mizzet can maintain concentration on two different spells at the same time. In addition, he has a bonus on saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Niv-Mizzet has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Master Chemister

entries.description: *Reaction:* The ghost has a trait based on who it is, as shown below:Enezesku: Enfeebling Ray. Enezesku's Innate Spellcasting trait includes ray of enfeeblement, which he can cast at will.Fautomni: Undead Fortitude. If damage reduces Fautomni to 0 HP, he must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, Fautomni drops to 1 hit point instead.Karlov: Unnatural Vigor. When Karlov regains HP, he has a bonus on attack rolls he makes on his next turn.Vuliev: Teleportation. Vuliev's Innate Spellcasting trait includes misty step, which he can cast at will.Xil Xaxosz: Lingering Spite. When Xil Xaxosz is reduced to 0 HP, his incorporeal form explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within 5 feet of him must make a Difficulty (16) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 14 (4d6) necrotic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The oinoloth touches one willing creature within 5 feet of it. The target regains all its HP. In addition, the oinoloth can end one disease on the target or remove one of the following conditions from it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The target then gains 1 level of exhaustion, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6). This reduction can be removed only by a wish spell or by casting greater restoration on the target three times within the same hour. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the oinoloth blights the area in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. the blight lasts for 24 hours. while the area is blighted, all normal plants there wither and die.furthermore, when a creature moves into the blighted area or starts its turn there, that creature must make a difficulty (16) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned. on a successful reaction roll, the creature is immune to the oinoloth's bringer of plagues for the next 24 hours.the poisoned creature can't regain hp. after every 24 hours that elapse, the poisoned creature can repeat the reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). this reduction lasts until the poison ends, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. the poison ends after the creature successfully saves against it three times.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any non-magical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.The Ooze Master can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Instinctive Attack
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): fear, slow, stinking cloud4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's black tentacles5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 3d6+3 acid damage.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Blessings of the Gods
entries.description: *Action:* While the oracle is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier. In addition, a creature that hits the oracle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The oracle's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: guidance, light, thaumaturgy3/day each: bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person1/day each: augury, scrying

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The Oracle casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18)):At will: detect magic2/day each: dispel magic, mage armor, remove curse, sending1/day each: power word stun, scrying (as an action), wall of force

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the oracle teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space she can see within 60 feet of herself.

entries.name: Vector Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the oracle teleports one creature she can see within 60 feet of herself, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of herself. an unwilling target must succeed on a difficulty (18) charisma reaction roll to avoid the effect.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The Oracle uses Spellcasting.

entries.name: Vortex Jaunt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the oracle uses teleport, and immediately after she disappears, each creature within 30 feet of the space she left must succeed on a difficulty (18) constitution reaction roll or take 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Corrupted Carrier
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the orc is reduced to 0 HP, it explodes, and any creature within 10 feet of it must make a Difficulty (13) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and becomes poisoned. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A creature poisoned by this effect can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. While poisoned by this effect, a creature can't regain HP.

entries.description: *Passive:* The orc has a bonus on saving throws against poison and disease.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d4+2 necrotic damage.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the orc reduces itself to 0 hp, triggering its corrupted carrier trait.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: *Passive:* On each of its turns, the orc can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

entries.name: Hand of Shargaas
entries.description: *Reaction:* The orc deals 2 extra dice of damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack (included in its attacks).

entries.name: Shargaas's Sight
entries.description: *Passive:* Magical darkness doesn't impede the orc's darkvision.

entries.name: Slayer
entries.description: *Passive:* In the first round of a combat, the orc has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. If the orc hits a creature that round who was surprised, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

entries.name: Multiattack

entries.name: Master of Undeath
entries.description: *Reaction:* Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (18)), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead2 charges: power word kill1 charge each: circle of death, finger of death

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to orcus makes one tail or necrotic bolt attack.

entries.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. a cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of orcus's next turn. creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

entries.description: *Passive:* While the blood mage isn't blinded, it can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

entries.name: Focus
entries.description: *Reaction:* As a bonus action, the giant can target a creature it can see within 30 feet of it and make that creature its focus. The target remains the giant's focus for 1 minute, or until either the target or the giant drops to 0 HP. When the giant makes an attack roll against its focus, it adds a d4 to its attack roll. If the giant attacks a different target while it has a focus, it subtracts a d4 from its attack roll.

entries.description: *Reaction:* Magic and other features can't determine the corrupter's creature type. If a creature tries to read the corrupter's thoughts, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (20) Intelligence Reaction Roll or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the corrupter fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The corrupter magically transforms into any creature that is Small or Medium, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the corrupter is reduced to 0 HP or uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Cunning
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The corrupter escapes non-magical restraints and ends the grappled and restrained conditions on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the corrupter makes one whispering blade attack.

entries.name: Amorphous Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the corrupter dissolves into a shifting mass of flesh, tentacles, eyes, claws, and mouths. up to two creatures the corrupter can see within 20 feet of itself must make a difficulty (20) intelligence reaction roll, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. this transformation lasts until the end of the corrupter's next turn. while transformed, the corrupter has a bonus on attack rolls, attack rolls made against it have penalty, and it can move through spaces at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Wisdom Reaction Roll: DC equals your spell Reaction Roll DC, one creature within 60 feet the steed can see. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fey Step (Fey Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the steed teleports, along with its rider, to an unoccupied space of your choice up to 60 feet away from itself.

entries.name: Healing Touch (Celestial Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)

entries.name: Communal Spellcasting (2/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save DC 12). The pech works with three or more pechs to cast spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)). If at least three other pechs are within 30 feet of it, the pech can cast Wall of Stone. If at least seven other pechs are within 30 feet of it, it can cast Greater Restoration.
