entries.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature in 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the phoenix must make a Difficulty (20) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.The explosion destroys the phoenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals 21 (6d6) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

entries.name: Fire Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

entries.name: Semblance of Life
entries.description: *Reaction:* The podling is a physical copy of a creature digested by a bodytaker plant. The podling has the digested creature's memories and behaves like that creature, but with occasional lapses. An observer familiar with the digested creature can recognize the discrepancies with a successful Difficulty (20) Wisdom (Insight) check, or automatically if the podling does something in direct contradiction to the digested creature's established beliefs or behavior. The podling melts into a slurry when it dies, when the bodytaker plant that created it dies, or when the bodytaker plant dismisses it (no action required).

entries.description: *Reaction:* When Polukranos takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of Polukranos takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: *Passive:* Polukranos can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Polukranos fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: *Passive:* Polukranos has five heads. While it has more than one head, Polukranos has a bonus on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever Polukranos takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, Polukranos dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken 40 or more fire damage since its last turn. Polukranos regains 20 HP for each head regrown in this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* For each head Polukranos has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only to make opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* Polukranos deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: *Passive:* While Polukranos sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

entries.name: Tattoo of Osybus
entries.description: *Passive:* If the priest drops to 0 HP, roll on the Boons of Undeath table for the boon the priest receives. The priest dies if it receives a boon it already has. If it receives a new boon, it revives at the start of its next turn with half its HP restored, and its creature type is now Undead.To prevent this revival, the Tattoo of Osybus on the priest's body must be destroyed. The tattoo is invulnerable while the priest has at least 1 hit point. The tattoo is otherwise an object with AC 15, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage. It has 15 HP, but it regains all its HP at the end of every combatant's turn.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to wisdom reaction roll: difficulty (10), one creature within 20 feet. failure: the target has the frightened condition. at the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success. after 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the quasit shape-shifts to resemble a bat (speed 10 ft., fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or it returns to its true form. its game statistics are the same in each form, except for its speed. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The quavilithku has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The quavilithku can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: *Reaction:* When in contact with a web, the quavilithku knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: *Passive:* The quavilithku ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Dissolving Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (18). Targets who fail take 8d10 acid damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Assess Weakness
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the quavilithku sizes up a creature it can see within 40 feet of itself. until the start of the quavilithku's next turn, it has a bonus on attack rolls against the creature.

entries.name: Inspiring Presence
entries.description: *Passive:* Creatures of Forfallen's choice (excluding herself) in a 30-foot Emanation originating from her have bonus on attack rolls. She can't use this trait if she has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Forfallen has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Rust's Grip
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to constitution reaction roll: difficulty (16), one creature forfallen can see within 20 feet. the target has penalty on this reaction roll if it has the poisoned condition. first failure: the target has the restrained condition and repeats the reaction roll at the end of its next turn if it's still restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. second failure: the target has the petrified condition instead of the restrained condition, becoming a statue of rusted iron.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.description: *Passive:* Creatures of the knight's choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from it have Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions while there.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature is charmed by the radiant idol. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the Reaction Roll, a creature is immune to this radiant idol's Aura of False Divinity for 24 hours.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* The radiant idol's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (17)). The radiant idol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: charm person, cure wounds, disguise self, thaumaturgy1/day each: commune, dominate person, insect plague, mass suggestion, raise dead

entries.description: *Passive:* Rak Tulkhesh has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Whirlwind of Weapons
entries.description: *Action:* A magical aura of weapons surrounds Rak Tulkhesh in a 10 foot radius. At the start of each of his turns, any other creature in the aura takes 14 (4d6) force damage.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Rak Tulkhesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than his own, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (his choice).In a new form, Rak Tulkhesh retains his alignment, HP, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Rakdos must make a Difficulty (25) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature becomes charmed by Rakdos for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from him. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature becomes immune to Rakdos's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

entries.name: Cruel Entertainment
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature Rakdos can see within 60 feet of him is reduced to 0 HP, Rakdos gains 25 temporary HP.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Rakdos's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (25)). He can innately cast hellish rebuke (at 5th level) at will, requiring no material components.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If Rakdos fails a Reaction Roll, he can choose to succeed instead.

The target must succeed on a Difficulty (25) Constitution Reaction Roll or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't maintain concentration on a spell or any other effect that requires concentration. The poisoned creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Without the rakshasa's permission, no spell can observe the rakshasa remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a whisper or chitter. A hearer can discern the sounds are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Shrapnel Explosion
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the razerblast drops to 0 HP, a flaming orb in its chest explodes, destroying the razerblast's body and scattering its armor as shrapnel. Creatures within 10 feet of the razerblast when it explodes must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack

entries.description: *Passive:* If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the blight move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight is animate.

entries.name: Spider Climb

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet shunted.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Haunt Creature
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The spirit targets a creature it can see within 10 feet of itself and begins haunting it. While the target is haunted, you and the spirit sense the direction and distance to the target if it is on the same plane of existence as you. Additionally, if the target starts its turn within 10 feet of the spirit, the target must succeed on a Wisdom Reaction Roll against your spell Reaction Roll DC or have the frightened condition until the start of the target's next turn. The target remains haunted until it dies, the spirit disappears, or the spirit uses this action again.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the abishai chooses up to four other creatures within 60 feet of it that can see it. until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with a bonus and can't be frightened.

entries.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the abishai targets one dragon it can see within 120 feet of it. the dragon must make a difficulty (18) charisma reaction roll. a chromatic dragon makes this reaction roll with penalty. on a successful reaction roll, the target is immune to the abishai's power of the dragon queen for 1 hour. on a failed reaction roll, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. while charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. this effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

entries.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.description: *Reaction:* While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a Difficulty (12) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Probing Telepathy
entries.description: *Passive:* If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: *Reaction:* A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for Reaction Roll proficiencies), and Reaction Roll DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (acid).

entries.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the Reaction Roll. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the Reaction Roll when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

entries.name: Detect
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aboleth makes a wisdom (perception) check.

entries.name: Tail Swipe
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the aboleth makes one tail attack.

entries.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hp equal to the damage the creature takes.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Protect allies

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a Difficulty (10) Constitution Reaction Roll if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll.If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

entries.name: Antimagic Cone
entries.description: *Passive:* The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: *Reaction:* A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for Reaction Roll proficiencies), and Reaction Roll DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d6 damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:1. Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be charmed by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.2. Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Strength Reaction Roll or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is incapacitated.If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Wisdom Reaction Roll or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 HP, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.If the target is a Large or smaller non-magical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a Reaction Roll. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Dexterity Reaction Roll or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 HP.

name: Reduced-Threat Black Pudding

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any non-magical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the acid damage dealt.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP.

Targets who fail take 1d6+3 damage and have the Blinded condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

entries.description: *Passive:* While in dim light or darkness, the reflection can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: *Passive:* While in sunlight, the reflection has penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Strength Drain
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 2d6+2 necrotic damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The refraction is aware of creatures within 100 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: *Action:* The refraction can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the refraction fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The refraction has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Relentless (2)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 2 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to creatures of the refraction's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a difficulty (19) intelligence reaction roll or take 33 (5d10 + 6) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. a stunned creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The refraction casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (19)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts3/day each: dispel magic, modify memory1/day each: feeblemind, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the refraction teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied place that it can see.

entries.name: Mindbreaker
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the refraction targets a creature within 120 feet of itself and disrupts its mental processes, causing the target to have penalty on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Projected Claw (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the refraction makes one dissonant claw attack.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: *Passive:* A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any non-magical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, non-magical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the pudding takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the pudding's next turn. The pudding dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+3 acid damage.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: *Reaction:* A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the chieftain hits with it (included in the attack).

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Bloodheart Stake
entries.description: *Passive:* The impaler is magically bound to the ceremonial stake and the sacrificed corpse the ritual caster used to create it. If the impaler is reduced to 0 HP, it disappears, then re-forms 1d8 hours later in the nearest unoccupied space to the stake and regains all its HP. The impaler dies only if it is reduced to 0 HP while either the ceremonial stake is removed from the sacrifice's corpse or the impaler is on a different plane of existence from that corpse.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the impaler fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Speed Spike
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the impaler teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. it can then make a spike attack.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The juggernaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

A creature the juggernaut can see within 60 feet of it must make a Difficulty (18) Dexterity Reaction Roll. If the Reaction Roll fails, the targeted creature is struck by one of the following (juggernaut's choice):

entries.name: Flying Stone
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the target takes 22 (5d8) bludgeoning damage and is incapacitated until the start of the juggernaut's next turn, and the implement vanishes.

entries.name: Scything Shrapnel
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the target takes 14 (4d6) slashing damage, and the implement vanishes. at the start of each of its turns, the target takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage from the wound left by the shrapnel. the wound ends if the target regains any hp or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful difficulty (15) wisdom (medicine) check.

entries.name: Implacable Advance
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the juggernaut moves up to its speed, ignoring difficult terrain. any object in its path takes 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage if it isn't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Rapid Shaping (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the juggernaut recharges deadly shaping and uses it.

entries.name: Shrouded Presence

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+4 damage.

The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Far range. Targets this adversary succeeds against take the standard attack damage.

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Rancid Degeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* At the end of each of the troll's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, unless the troll has taken acid or fire damage since the end of its last turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: *Passive:* If the rothé moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+4 damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: *Passive:* The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: *Passive:* The mimic has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have penalty.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+3 acid damage.

name: Rubblebelt Stalker

entries.name: Ambusher
entries.description: *Passive:* In the first round of a combat, the stalker has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: *Passive:* The stalker can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Ruin Dweller
entries.description: *Passive:* The stalker has a bonus on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in ruins, and its speed is not reduced in difficult terrain composed of rubble.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* The stalker deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Trampling Charge
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Strength Reaction Roll or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 4d8+7 psychic damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 4d10+7 psychic damage.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary deals damage with a standard attack, you can spend a Fear to gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the ruin grinder is subjected to fire damage, it regains a number of HP equal to half the fire damage dealt.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* The ruin grinder deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: *Passive:* The ruin grinder can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks.

entries.name: Ruinous Acid
entries.description: *Passive:* Any non-magical weapon that hits the spider corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. non-magical ammunition made of metal that hits the spider is destroyed after dealing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: *Passive:* The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Encasing Rust
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to constitution reaction roll: difficulty (19), one creature within 20 feet of the rusted. failure: 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target has the poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. while poisoned, the target has the paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Immobilizing Fear
entries.description: *Reaction:* When a creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more rutterkins, that creature must make a Difficulty (11) Wisdom Reaction Roll. The creature has penalty on the Reaction Roll if it's within 30 feet of six or more rutterkins. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature becomes frightened of the rutterkins for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is restrained. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rutterkins for 24 hours.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 3d6+2 poison damage and becomes *Poisoned*.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: *Passive:* With a 10-foot running start, the tiger can Long Jump up to 25 feet.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the tiger takes the disengage or hide action.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the statue is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the statue move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the statue isn't an object.

entries.name: Ghostly Inhabitant
entries.description: *Reaction:* The eidolon that enters the statue remains inside it until the statue drops to 0 HP, the eidolon uses a bonus action to move out of the statue, or the eidolon is turned or forced out by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the eidolon leaves the statue, it appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the statue.

entries.name: Inert
entries.description: *Passive:* Without an eidolon inside, the statue is an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The statue doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Whirlpool (1/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the wave shaper targets a body of water at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep, causing a whirlpool to form in the center of the area. the whirlpool forms a vortex that is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, 25 feet tall, and lasts for 1 minute or until the wave shaper is incapacitated. any creature or object in the water and within 25 feet of the vortex is pulled 10 feet toward it. a creature can swim away from the vortex by succeeding on a difficulty (14) strength (athletics) check.when a creature enters the vortex for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a difficulty (14) strength reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the creature takes 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and is caught in the vortex until it ends. on a success, the creature takes half damage and isn't caught in the vortex. a creature caught in the vortex can use its action to try to swim away from the vortex as described above, but it has penalty on the strength (athletics) check to do so.the first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. this damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (25). Targets who fail take 11d12 magic damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. no one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. each targeted creature must succeed on a difficulty (26) strength reaction roll or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. at the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.at the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. in addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 HP or uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw attack.

entries.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 5d10 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush, Overwhelm

Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a Difficulty (15) Strength check against it.

entries.name: Bound
entries.description: *Passive:* The guardian is magically bound to an amulet. While the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (round up) is transferred to the guardian.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The guardian regains 10 HP at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Spell Storing
entries.description: *Reaction:* A spellcaster who wears the guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of level 4 or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian while within 5 feet of it. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. Any previously stored spell is lost when a new spell is stored. The guardian can cast the spell stored with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no spell components and using the caster's spellcasting ability. The stored spell is then lost.

entries.name: Contamination
entries.description: *Reaction:* The sibriex emits an aura of corruption 30 feet in every direction. Vegetation withers in the aura, and the ground in the aura is difficult terrain for other creatures. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a Difficulty (20) Constitution Reaction Roll or take 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on the Reaction Roll is immune to this sibriex's Contamination for 24 hours.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the sibriex fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the sibriex targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. the target must succeed on a difficulty (20) dexterity reaction roll or take 31 (9d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Warp Creature
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The sibriex targets up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must make a Difficulty (20) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a successful Reaction Roll, a creature becomes immune to this sibriex's Warp Creature. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target is poisoned, which causes it to also gain 1 level of exhaustion. While poisoned in this way, the target must repeat the Reaction Roll at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it, and ending the poison removes any levels of exhaustion caused by it. Each failed Reaction Roll causes the target to gain another level of exhaustion. Once the target reaches 6 levels of exhaustion, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes under the sibriex's control. The transformation of the body can be undone only by a wish spell.

Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

If the target is prone, the leopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to each creature within 30 feet of the muse must make a difficulty (13) wisdom reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the creature has the charmed condition for 1 minute. on a successful reaction roll, the creature becomes immune to any muse's enchanting presence for 24 hours.whenever the muse deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: *Reaction:* If the solar fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the soul shaker is reduced to 0 HP, it explodes into 7 (1d4 + 5) crawling claws. After 6 (1d12) days, if at least two of those crawling claws are alive, they teleport to the location of the soul shaker's death and merge together, whereupon the soul shaker reforms and regains all its HP.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The soul shaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d8+5 damage.

entries.name: Dying Burst
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the clown drops to 0 HP, it pops like a balloon, releasing a splash of putrid, corrosive ichor. Each creature within 5 feet of the clown when it bursts must make a Difficulty (12) Dexterity Reaction Roll, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Squeakers
entries.description: *Reaction:* The clown wears shoes that squeak when it walks. The squeaking can be heard out to a range of 30 feet. The squeaking is silenced while the clown's Phantasmal Form is in effect.

entries.name: Phantasmal Form (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The clown veils itself and everything it is wearing and carrying in an illusion that makes it look like some other creature of its size or smaller (such as a child) or an object small enough to fit in the clown's space (such as a floating balloon). Maintaining this effect requires the clown's concentration (as if concentrating on a spell), and the illusion fails to hold up to physical inspection. As an action, a creature that can see the clown's illusory form can make a Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Insight) check, piercing the illusion and discerning the clown's true form on a success.

If the spawn takes acid, fire, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the spawn's next turn. The spawn is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The spawn of Kyuss requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Worms
entries.description: *Passive:* If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Burrowing Worm action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Burrowing Worm
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to a worm launches from the spawn of kyuss at one humanoid that the spawn can see within 10 feet of it. the worm latches onto the target's skin unless the target succeeds on a difficulty (11) dexterity reaction roll. the worm is a tiny undead with ac 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. while on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action (the spawn can use burrowing worm to launch a scraped-off worm at a humanoid it can see within 10 feet of the worm). otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. at the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of 10d6), and if it drops to 0 hp, it dies and then rises 10 minutes later as a spawn of kyuss. if a worm-infested target is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: *Passive:* No magic can observe the sphinx remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with penalty.

entries.name: Roar (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The sphinx emits a magical roar. Whenever it roars, the roar has a different effect, as detailed below (the sequence resets when it takes a Long Rest):First Roar. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (20), each enemy in a 500-foot Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition for 1 minute.Second Roar. Wisdom Reaction Roll: Difficulty (20), each enemy in a 500-foot Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition, and it repeats the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.Third Roar. Constitution Reaction Roll: Difficulty (20), each enemy in a 500-foot Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: 44 (8d10) Thunder damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: *Passive:* If the tomb guardian takes fire damage, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the tomb guardian starts its turn with 40 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the tomb guardian goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the tomb guardian attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the tomb guardian attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the tomb guardian goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP. The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk tomb guardian, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The tomb guardian must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the tomb guardian ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 HP or fewer, the tomb guardian might go berserk again.

entries.name: Chained
entries.description: *Reaction:* This trait applies when two guardians are chained together.A magical spiked chain that binds a pair of guardians together prevents them from moving more than 15 feet apart. Additionally, as long as the chain is intact, damage dealt to either guardian is divided evenly between them. The spiked chain can be attacked separately and has AC 18, a damage threshold of 10, 5 HP, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. If the chain breaks, both tomb guardians instantly go berserk.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the tomb guardian is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb guardian has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.description: *Passive:* While it has at least 1 hit point, the apparition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entries.description: *Action:* The apparition can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The apparition doesn't require air, drink, food, or sleep.

entries.name: Radiant Eruption
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 5d6+3 radiant damage.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. One Humanoid that the apparition can see within 5 feet of itself must succeed on a Difficulty (14) Charisma Reaction Roll or be possessed by the apparition; the apparition then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The apparition now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The apparition can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 HP, the apparition ends it as a bonus action, the body leaves the Astral Plane, or the apparition is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the apparition reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. If it reappears in a location not on the Astral Plane, the apparition is destroyed. The target is immune to this apparition's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the Reaction Roll or after the possession ends.

entries.name: False Appearance

entries.name: Dreamwalker's Charm
entries.description: *Reaction:* An enemy that starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant must make a Difficulty (13) Charisma Reaction Roll, provided that the giant isn't incapacitated. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature is charmed by the giant. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to this giant's Dreamwalker's Charm for 24 hours.

entries.name: Petrifying Touch
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The giant touches one Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of it that is charmed by it. The target must make a Difficulty (17) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target becomes petrified, and the giant can adhere the target to its stony body. greater restoration spells and other magic that can undo petrification have no effect on a petrified creature adhered to the giant unless the giant is dead, in which case the magic works normally, freeing the petrified creature as well as ending the petrified condition on it.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the giant fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Stone Rune
entries.description: *Reaction:* The giant has a stone rune inscribed on a mineral object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Prismatic Rays action.The object bearing the rune has AC 18; 30 HP; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its HP at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 HP or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a stone rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

The giant targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around the target, who must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Strength Reaction Roll or be moved up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the giant chooses.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the giant hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. the target must make a difficulty (18) dexterity reaction roll, taking 22 (4d10) thunder damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: One with the Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The giant vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The giant can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a giant once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the giant can't take any actions other than lair actions, and it can't be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The giant can't use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.

entries.name: Psychic Wave (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the herald unleashes a blast of psionic energy into the minds of up to three creatures it can see within 90 feet of itself. each target must make a difficulty (21) intelligence reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, a target takes 23 (3d10 + 7) psychic damage and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. on a successful reaction roll, a target takes half as much damage only. an affected creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.if a creature is reduced to 0 hp by this psychic damage, it dies and its head explodes if it has one.

entries.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries.description: *Action:* Whenever the zombie takes at least 5 bludgeoning or slashing damage at one time, roll a d20 to determine what else happens to it:1–8: One leg is severed from the zombie if it has any legs left.9–16: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any arms left.17–20: The zombie is decapitated.If the zombie is reduced to 0 HP, all parts of it die. Until then, a severed part acts on the zombie's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 8. Any damage it takes is subtracted from the zombie's HP.A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with penalty on the attack roll. Each time the zombie loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.If its head is severed, the zombie loses its bite attack and its body is blinded unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet. It can make a bite attack, but only against a target in its space.The zombie's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls prone. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0 feet, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the succubus shape-shifts to resemble a medium or small humanoid or back into its true form. its game statistics are the same in each form, except its fly speed is available only in its true form. any equipment it's wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: *Reaction:* Sul Khatesh's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: counterspell, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, eyebite, fireball, lightning bolt, shield3/day each: chain lightning, create undead, dream, hold monster, mass suggestion, scrying1/day each: foresight, gate, power word kill, teleport

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Sul Khatesh fails a Reaction Roll, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* Sul Khatesh has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Master of Magic
entries.description: *Passive:* Sul Khatesh has a bonus on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 11d12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Sul Khatesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. She reverts to her true form if she dies. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sul Khatesh's choice).In a new form, Sul Khatesh retains her alignment, HP, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks.

entries.name: Consume Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Sul Khatesh targets a creature within 120 feet of her who is concentrating on a spell. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (26) Constitution Reaction Roll or its concentration is broken on the spell, and Sul Khatesh gains 5 temporary HP per level of that spell.

entries.name: Maddening Secrets (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Sul Khatesh whispers an arcane secret into the mind of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (26) Wisdom Reaction Roll or expend one of its spell slots of 3rd level or lower and deal 26 (4d12) force damage to each creature within 30 feet of it. A creature that fails the Reaction Roll but can't expend a spell slot is instead stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Fearsome Presence
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a Difficulty (16) Wisdom Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature becomes frightened of the eladrin for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's Reaction Roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to strength reaction roll: difficulty (27), one large or smaller creature grappled by the tarrasque (it can have up to six creatures swallowed at a time). failure: the target is swallowed, and the grappled condition ends. a swallowed creature has the blinded and restrained conditions and can't teleport, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.if the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a difficulty (20) constitution reaction roll at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque and has the prone condition. if the tarrasque dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: *Passive:* The Telepathic Pentacle has five heads. While it has more than one head, the Telepathic Pentacle has a bonus on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.Whenever the Telepathic Pentacle takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the Telepathic Pentacle dies.At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The Telepathic Pentacle regains 10 HP for each head regrown in this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: *Reaction:* For each head the Telepathic Pentacle has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Wakeful

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The tlacatecolo magically transforms into a Medium owl, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the tlacatecolo is reduced to 0 HP or if it uses its action to end it.

entries.name: Plague Winds (Fiend Form Only; Recharge 5-6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail take 4d12 cold damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened, Corrupt

entries.name: Fire Aura
entries.description: *Passive:* At the start of each of the tlexolotl's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in that aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the tlexolotl or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: *Passive:* The tlexolotl sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The tlexolotl regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the tlexolotl takes cold damage or is immersed in water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the tlexolotl's next turn. The tlexolotl dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (fire).

entries.name: Pyroclasm (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a emanation of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (15). Targets who fail take 6d6 fire damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: *Passive:* While in sunlight, the tomb dwarf has penalty on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (necrotic).

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: *Passive:* If the tomb guardian takes fire damage, it has penalty on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the tomb guardian starts its turn with 40 HP or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the tomb guardian goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the tomb guardian attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the tomb guardian attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the tomb guardian goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP. The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk tomb guardian, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The tomb guardian must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the tomb guardian ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 HP or fewer, the tomb guardian might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: *Passive:* Whenever the tomb guardian is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb guardian has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: *Passive:* The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Petrified Death
entries.description: *Passive:* A tomb tapper reduced to 0 HP turns into a lifeless stone statue. Anything it's wearing or carrying is not transformed.

entries.name: Sense Magic
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb tapper senses magic within 30 feet of it and can use an action to pinpoint the location of any creature, object, or area in that range that bears magic. This sense penetrates barriers but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb tapper can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The tomb tapper doesn't require air or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 3 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

name: Topaz Dragon Wyrmling

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* The dragon can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Bite

entries.name: Desiccating Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (11). Targets who fail take 6d6 necrotic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (12)):1/day: bane

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.
