name: Topaz Greatwyrm

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 HP, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 HP, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the greatwyrm fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: *Passive:* The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Agility Reaction Roll (25). Targets who fail take 11d12 magic damage and have the Prone condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. no one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. each targeted creature must succeed on a difficulty (26) strength reaction roll or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. at the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the reaction roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.at the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. in addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 HP or uses a bonus action to end it.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the greatwyrm makes one claw attack.

entries.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to use this ability in a Far range line. All targets within that area must make Instinct Reaction Roll (26). Targets who fail take 5d10 psychic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

motives_tactics: Hoard treasure, Dominate by force, Crush, Overwhelm

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the trapper is motionless on a floor, wall, or ceiling at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the trapper move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the trapper isn't part of the floor, wall, or ceiling.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: *Passive:* The trapper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Smother
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one large or smaller creature within 10 feet of the trapper must succeed on a difficulty (13) dexterity reaction roll or be grappled (escape difficulty (14)). until the grapple ends, the target takes 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. while grappled in this way, the target is restrained, blinded, and deprived of air. the trapper can smother only one creature at a time.

Each tree uses the Treant stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, it can't speak, and it lacks this action. The tree takes its turn immediately after the treant on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the treant. A tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, the treant dies, or it is more than 120 feet from the treant. The tree then takes root if possible.

The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree, or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

The limb acts immediately after the troll's turn. The troll has 1 Exhaustion level for each missing limb, and it grows replacement limbs the next time it regains HP.

entries.description: *Reaction:* When the troll mutate is created, it gains one of four possible body mutations at random: 1, Elastic Body; 2, Psionic Mirror; 3, Spell Scarred; or 4, Winged Form. This mutation determines certain traits in this stat block.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The mutate regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the mutate takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the mutate's next turn. The mutate dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate. If the mutate starts its turn with 0 HP and regenerates, it randomly gains a mutation it doesn't already have (up to a maximum of four mutations).

entries.name: Amorphous (Elastic Body Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* The mutate can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance (Spell Scarred Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* The mutate has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Psychic Rebuke (Psionic Mirror Only)
entries.description: *Passive:* If the mutate takes psychic damage, each creature within 20 feet of it takes that damage as well.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (magic).

entries.name: Psychic Burst (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the mutate unleashes a wave of psychic energy. each creature within 30 feet of the mutate must make a difficulty (14) intelligence reaction roll, taking 28 (8d6) psychic damage on a failed reaction roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

name: Tromokratis

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: *Passive:* Tromokratis can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Hearts of the Kraken (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Reaction:* When Tromokratis is reduced to 0 HP, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, the damage creates cracks in its carapace, revealing its hearts. Tromokratis has four hearts: two on its chest, one on its back, and one at the base of its tail. A heart has an AC of 22 and 100 HP. It is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks, and it is immune to all conditions. If it is forced to make a Reaction Roll, treat its ability scores as 10 (+0). If it finishes a short or long rest, the carapace heals, any destroyed hearts regenerate, and the hearts are covered again. Tromokratis dies when all the hearts are destroyed.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If Tromokratis fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: *Passive:* Tromokratis's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: *Passive:* Tromokratis deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Spell-Resistant Carapace
entries.description: *Passive:* Tromokratis has a bonus on saving throws against spells, and any creature that makes a spell attack against Tromokratis has penalty on the attack roll.

Both trees must be Large or bigger.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to trostani animates one or two trees she can see within 120 feet of her, causing them to uproot themselves and become awakened trees (see the monster manual for their stat blocks) for 1 minute or until trostani uses a bonus action to end the effect. these trees understand druidic and obey trostani's spoken commands, but can't speak. if she issues no commands to them, the trees do nothing but follow her and take the dodge action.

entries.name: Disgorge Zombie
entries.description: *Reaction:* As a bonus action, the tyrannosaurus zombie can disgorge a normal zombie, which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The disgorged zombie acts on its own initiative count. After a zombie is disgorged, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the tyrannosaurus zombie runs out of zombies to disgorge and loses this trait. If the tyrannosaurus zombie still has this trait when it dies, 1d4 normal zombies erupt from its corpse at the start of its next turn. These zombies act on their own initiative count.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the tyrannosaurus zombie to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: *Passive:* The ulitharid is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The ulitharid has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Psionic Hub
entries.description: *Passive:* If an elder brain establishes a psychic link with the ulitharid, the elder brain can form a psychic link with any other creature the ulitharid can detect using its Creature Sense. Any such link ends if the creature falls outside the telepathy ranges of both the ulitharid and the elder brain. The ulitharid can maintain its psychic link with the elder brain regardless of the distance between them, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence. If the ulitharid is more than 5 miles away from the elder brain, it can end the psychic link at any time (no action required).

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The tree magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the tree. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the tree dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the tree takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

The target must make a Difficulty (14) Constitution Reaction Roll. If the Reaction Roll fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the Reaction Roll begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

Once in its resting place, it returns to its vampire form and has the Paralyzed condition until it regains any HP, and it regains 1 Hit Point after spending 1 hour there.

The Charmed target is a willing recipient of the vampire's Bite, the damage of which doesn't end the spell. When the spell ends, the target is unaware it was Charmed by the vampire.

entries.name: Shape-Shift

[hover]), or it returns to its vampire form. anything it is wearing transforms with it.while in bat form, the vampire can't speak. its game statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged.while in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. it is weightless and can enter an enemy's space and stop there. if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so, but it can't pass through liquid. it has resistance to all damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

name: Vargouille

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 1d6+2 poison damage.

entries.name: Abyssal Curse
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The vargouille targets one incapacitated Humanoid within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Charisma Reaction Roll or become cursed. The cursed target loses 1 point of Charisma after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell; don't count that time. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, it dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete can end the curse. Doing so undoes the changes made to the target by the curse.

entries.name: Stunning Shriek (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the vargouille shrieks. each humanoid and beast within 30 feet of the vargouille and able to hear it must succeed on a difficulty (12) wisdom reaction roll or be frightened of the vargouille until the end of the vargouille's next turn. while frightened in this way, a target is stunned. if a target's reaction roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the stunning shriek of all vargouilles for 1 hour.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

entries.name: Magic Resistance

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d6+2 psychic damage.

entries.name: Abyssal Curse
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The vargouille targets one Humanoid within 5 feet of itself that has the incapacitated condition. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Charisma Reaction Roll or become cursed. The cursed target's Charisma decreases by 1 after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects, and its Charisma can't increase. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, the target dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille reflection. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete ends the curse and restores the target's Charisma.

entries.name: Horrific Reflection (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The vargouille's head mimics that of a Humanoid the vargouille can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Wisdom Reaction Roll or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the frightened condition for 1 hour or until the vargouille loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). If the target's Reaction Roll is successful or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Horrific Reflection of all vargouille reflections for 1 hour.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

motives_tactics: Aid allies, Disrupt enemies, Corrupt, Destroy

name: Vecna Impersonator

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: *Passive:* The impersonator can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries.description: *Passive:* In the first round of a combat, the impersonator has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: *Passive:* If the impersonator surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage.

entries.name: Read Thoughts
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range area. All targets within that area must make a Reaction Roll against this adversary's Difficulty. Targets who fail take damage equal to this adversary's standard attack damage (magic).

entries.name: Momentum
entries.description: *Reaction:* When this adversary makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entries.name: Tactician
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to spotlight this adversary and two allies within Close range.

motives_tactics: Command allies, Coordinate attacks, Maintain authority

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The vegepygmy regains 3 HP at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Toxic Mold (2/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the vegepygmy targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. if the target isn't a vegepygmy, it must make a difficulty (13) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, the target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage and has the blinded and deafened conditions for 1 minute as it becomes covered in a thick layer of mold. on a successful reaction roll, the target takes half as much damage only.the target can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d8+2 damage.

entries.name: Inviolate Presence
entries.description: *Passive:* The veiled presence can't be targeted by divination magic or by features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the veiled presence fails a Reaction Roll, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Relentless (3)
entries.description: *Passive:* This adversary can be spotlighted up to 3 times per conflict. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 1 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (radiant).

entries.name: Revelation
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the veiled presence reveals a glimpse of its otherworldly nature to a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. the target must succeed on a difficulty (22) wisdom reaction roll or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this revelation for 24 hours.

entries.name: Flash Step
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The veiled presence magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

entries.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the veiled presence makes one blade of judgment attack.

entries.name: Searing Radiance (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The veiled presence magically emanates dazzling light in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself until the end of its next turn, during which time attack rolls against it have penalty and it has a bonus on attack rolls. The sphere moves with the veiled presence. When another creature starts its turn in the light or enters the light for the first time on its turn, that creature must make a Difficulty (22) Constitution Reaction Roll, taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed Reaction Roll, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend two Fear to exhale destructive energy in a Far range cone. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (25). Targets who fail take 7d12 lightning damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. Velomachus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: contact other plane (as an action, contacting a long-dead spirit), divination, move earth, wall of force

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to velomachus makes one claw attack.

entries.name: Chaotic Flow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to velomachus moves up to half her flying speed. if a creature hits or misses her with an opportunity attack during this move, the attacker takes 19 (3d12) thunder damage.

entries.name: Repeating History (Costs 3 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to summon 1 ally, who appear at Far range.

entries.name: Poison Splash
entries.description: *Reaction:* When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The troll regains 10 HP at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Venom Spray (Recharge 6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a 15-foot cube. the troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). each creature in the area must make a difficulty (16) constitution reaction roll. on a failed reaction roll, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. on a successful reaction roll, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. a poisoned creature can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Simple Weapon Wielder
entries.description: *Reaction:* A simple weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the verbeeg hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: *Passive:* If the violet fungus is motionless at the start of combat, it has a bonus on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the fungus move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the violet fungus isn't ordinary fungus.

entries.name: Absorb Body
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to strength reaction roll: difficulty (15), one medium or small creature the necrohulk can see within 5 feet. failure: the target is pulled into the necrohulk's space and becomes grafted to its body. the necrohulk can have only one target grafted at a time.while grafted, the target has the restrained condition and penalty on constitution saving throws. when the necrohulk moves, the grafted target moves with it. if the target dies while grafted, its body is destroyed, and the necrohulk regains 10 hp.the grafted target or a creature within 5 feet of the necrohulk can take an action to make a difficulty (15) strength (athletics) check. on a successful check, the target is no longer grafted and moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the necrohulk.

name: Vistana Assassin

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: *Passive:* During its first turn, the assassin has a bonus on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: *Reaction:* If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity Reaction Roll to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the Reaction Roll, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The assassin deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has a bonus on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have penalty on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make 2 standard attacks. Each attack deals the standard damage (poison).

entries.name: Curse (Recharges After a Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a Far range area. All targets within that area must make Presence Reaction Roll (11). Targets who fail take 1d6 psychic damage and have the Deafened and Blinded conditions until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.name: Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. As an action, a Vistana can target a creature within 10 feet that the Vistana can see. This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of the animal friendship, charm person, or hold person spell (Vistana's choice; spell Difficulty (11)), but requires neither somatic nor material components. If the target succeeds on the Reaction Roll, the Vistana is blinded until the end of the Vistana's next turn.A Vistana who uses Evil Eye can't use it again before finishing a short or long rest. Once a target succeeds on a Reaction Roll against a Vistana's Evil Eye, it is immune to the Evil Eye of all Vistani for 24 hours.

motives_tactics: Ambush, Strike from shadows, Escape when threatened

entries.name: Corrupt Water
entries.description: *Reaction:* At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a Difficulty (18) Constitution Reaction Roll. On a successful Reaction Roll, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the Reaction Roll. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest.If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary HP.

On a failed Reaction Roll, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful Reaction Roll, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

The boon's recipient gains a d4 and can, at any time within the next 24 hours, roll this die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or Reaction Roll made by it. No creature can have more than one of these magic boons at a time.

The charmed creature can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's Reaction Roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the Reaction Roll, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Reaction:* The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a Difficulty (12) Constitution Reaction Roll or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.The possession lasts until either the body drops to 0 HP, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

entries.name: Spellcasting

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the creeper's flowers release a strong musk that targets all humanoids within 30 feet of it. each target must succeed on a difficulty (11) wisdom reaction roll or be charmed by the creeper for 1 minute. a creature charmed in this way does nothing on its turn except move as close as it can to the creeper. a creature charmed by the creeper can repeat the reaction roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: *Reaction:* If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a Constitution Reaction Roll with a DC of 5 +the damage taken, unless the damage is fire or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. on a success, the target takes 1d8+1 damage.

name: Yeth Hound

entries.name: Sunlight Banishment
entries.description: *Passive:* If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: *Passive:* While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against a target. On a success, the target takes 2d6+4 psychic damage and becomes *Frightened*.

entries.name: Baleful Baying
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a Difficulty (13) Wisdom Reaction Roll or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: *Reaction:* If a creature starts its turn within 15 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a Difficulty (12) Constitution Reaction Roll if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed Reaction Roll, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the Reaction Roll at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the Reaction Roll.If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: *Passive:* The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: *Passive:* The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: *Passive:* The wereraven regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the wereraven takes damage from a silvered weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wereraven's next turn. The wereraven dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Poison Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability in a cone of Medium range. All targets within that area must make Finesse Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 6d6 poison damage and have the Blinded condition until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (15)):At will: Animal Friendship (snakes only)3/day: Suggestion

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the yuan-ti shape-shifts into a large snake or returns to its true form. if it dies, it stays in its current form. the yuan-ti's game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Harass
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to force a PC within Close range to make a test against this adversary's Difficulty or mark a Stress.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: *Passive:* The anathema has a bonus on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
entries.description: *Reaction:* Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema must succeed on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom Reaction Roll or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's Reaction Roll is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathema's aura for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Six Heads

entries.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to use this ability. The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature.The target must make a Difficulty (13) Intelligence Reaction Roll. On a failed Reaction Roll, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the Reaction Roll at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to 10 feet away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa's choice.

Targets who fail take 5d6 lightning damage and have the Prone and Restrained conditions until the end of their next turn. Targets who succeed take half damage only.

entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the zaratan retracts into its shell. until it takes its emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. the next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its revitalize or emerge action.

entries.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Spend a Fear to the zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. it regains 52 (5d20) hp. the next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its emerge action.

entries.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to the zaratan emerges from its shell and makes one spit rock attack. it can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to use this ability. Zuggtmoy casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell Reaction Roll Difficulty (22)):At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants3/day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth1/day each: etherealness, teleport

entries.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a difficulty (19) constitution reaction roll. on a successful reaction roll, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. on a failed reaction roll, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of zuggtmoy, which lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. while infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the reaction roll at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. on a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be.

entries.name: Mind Control Spores (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. humanoids and beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a difficulty (19) wisdom reaction roll. on a successful reaction roll, a creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. on a failed reaction roll, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of zuggtmoy for 24 hours. while infected in this way, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.

entries.name: Attack
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to zuggtmoy makes one pseudopod attack.

entries.name: Exert Will
entries.description: *Action:* Mark a Stress to one creature charmed by zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction, if a available, to move up to its speed as she directs or to make one weapon attack against a target that she designates.
